[{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-01-09 15:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-01-09 15:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Heya Ben, this predates me a bit: do you know if the option undercloud_db_password was meant for the db root user initially (seems currently unused)? The description says "Password used for MySQL databases." so am not sure if this used to be a password shared across all different databases that went disused.
If it was meant for the root user then am happy to piggyback, otherwise maybe I should add a new option and we deprecate _db_password?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:34:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Based on https://github.com/openstack/instack-undercloud/blob/472a5891110b92bda9f0eaa87a7372c958f91324/instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py#L952 I'm inclined to say this is right.  That said, I don't specifically remember what this was supposed to be used for (it apparently goes all the way back to the initial Python version of the undercloud install, so it may even predate me :-).

I see Carlos added the change that relied on it being the root password, so I've added him to the review too.  I'm a little confused how that would have worked if we weren't actually setting the mysql password to this value before, but in any case it looks like this is the right thing to do."}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:45:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Yeahp, this is correct.

I was going to raise a bug as what we currently have in undercloud-passwords.conf (undercloud_db_password 'UNDERCLOUD_DB_PASSWORD') does not match with any MySQL user, so this should fix it.

Should we raise a bug to track this? As I believe we should backport this if affects previous versions."}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:49:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Yeahp, this is correct.
 > 
 > I was going to raise a bug as what we currently have in
 > undercloud-passwords.conf (undercloud_db_password 'UNDERCLOUD_DB_PASSWORD')
 > does not match with any MySQL user, so this should fix it.
 > 
 > Should we raise a bug to track this? As I believe we should
 > backport this if affects previous versions.

Thanks Ben & Carlos! Ack, I will raise a bug, cleanup that commit message and then do the backport dance."}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Set password for mysql root user on undercloud

The port is firewalled off by default so mysql is not reachable except
to localhost users. In any case it is good to set a password for the
mysql root user.

We are 'reusing' the user_db_password parameter, because it is actually
unused, instead of adding yet another parameter.

Tested this change against an existing undercloud and observed that
the mysql root user got a correct password and that the /root/.my.cnf
file got generated.

Closes-Bug: #1742191

Change-Id: I408ce3a0fe2ab8e86bcc280256cdb51688efde75

QNAP: Add support for QES 2.0.0

This patch do the following change to the QNAP Manila driver:

Deprecate OS::Aodh::Alarm

Theshold Alarm which depends on ceilometer api has been deprecated
in Aodh since Ocata.

commit_message:
Fix 'cluster' paramter using for v3 volume manage

The 'cluster' paramter is wrongly provided for v3 volume manage, as it
should be included in the 'volume' object.

Change-Id: I12440aa6ada9c0e058138e8da7f7bc12359847bb

@Lucas, How do we synchronize and create missing revision number rows when networking-ovn is upgrading and we have no revision number rows.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-12-22 09:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi Dong, 

Good point indeed, this patch is not addressing that and it should, otherwise old resources might fail on updates.

We could create the missing rows as part of the bump_revision() method, that would address the problem. We should tho, at least log a warning because these rows should have being created at precommit time (in the same db transaction that neutron is using to create the resource itself).

What do you think ?'}, {'account_id': 23458, 'date': '2017-12-22 11:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Great, Lucas, this worker works well in my local devstack.
Just a question I am not clear:'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-12-22 11:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Thanks Dong!'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-12-22 11:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> (2 comments)
 >

 > util to create initial ovn dbs. Since sync util code doesn't add
 > the revision numbers in ovn nb db, how does the maintenance thread
 > behave ?

 > be empty, the maintenance thread would try to create resources
 > right ? Will there be any side effects ?

I think this question was unaswered. Any thoughts ?


 > 
 > +1 for release notes."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-01-11 09:52:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> > (2 comments)
 > >
 > > Once these series merges, what about the sync util code ?
 > > Will it be still required ?
 > > Assuming we do a migration from ml2ovs to OVN and we run ovn sync
 > > util to create initial ovn dbs. Since sync util code doesn't add
 > > the revision numbers in ovn nb db, how does the maintenance
 > thread
 > > behave ?
 > > As per the code in this patch, since the ovn revision table would
 > > be empty, the maintenance thread would try to create resources
 > > right ? Will there be any side effects ?
 > 
 > I think this question was unaswered. Any thoughts ?
 > 

Oh sorry I missed the question. So, I think that at some point (probably after the migration) we could get rid of the sync util. Regarding the sync util not adding the revision numbers, we can easily change that by making the sync util use OVNClient instead of calling the ovsdb commands directly. It already does it in many parts but for the parts that it does not I believe a simpler refactor to remove the duplicate code and replace it with OVNClient's calls will guarantee that the revision numbers are created properly.

Overall, not having an initial revision number won't break networking-ovn, but, the maintenance thread won't monitor that resource. Also, any updates to that resource will automatically insert the revision number into it will make it traceable by the maintenance thread as well.

What do you think ?"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-01-11 10:25:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> > > (2 comments)
 > > >
 > > > Once these series merges, what about the sync util code ?
 > > > Will it be still required ?
 > > > Assuming we do a migration from ml2ovs to OVN and we run ovn
 > sync
 > > > util to create initial ovn dbs. Since sync util code doesn't
 > add
 > > > the revision numbers in ovn nb db, how does the maintenance
 > > thread
 > > > behave ?
 > > > As per the code in this patch, since the ovn revision table
 > would
 > > > be empty, the maintenance thread would try to create resources
 > > > right ? Will there be any side effects ?
 > >
 > > I think this question was unaswered. Any thoughts ?
 > >
 > 
 > Oh sorry I missed the question. So, I think that at some point
 > (probably after the migration) we could get rid of the sync util.
 > Regarding the sync util not adding the revision numbers, we can
 > easily change that by making the sync util use OVNClient instead of
 > calling the ovsdb commands directly. It already does it in many
 > parts but for the parts that it does not I believe a simpler
 > refactor to remove the duplicate code and replace it with
 > OVNClient's calls will guarantee that the revision numbers are
 > created properly.
 > 
 > Overall, not having an initial revision number won't break
 > networking-ovn, but, the maintenance thread won't monitor that
 > resource. Also, any updates to that resource will automatically
 > insert the revision number into it will make it traceable by the
 > maintenance thread as well.
 > 
 > What do you think ?

Another point I'd like to raise related to this, from a migration perspective is that maybe, instead of waiting for all objects to be updated so that they start getting tracked, we could do something during migration to install the initial revision number on the objects and start tracking them right away."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 17:17:19.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize inconsistency detection (Part 2)

This patch is introducing the maintenance mechanism for the database
consistency work.

This new mechanism is based on the futurist library [0].

The ``check_for_incosistencies`` task will compare the
"ovn_revision_numbers" table with the Neutron's "standardattributes" table
and check if there's any difference between the revision numbers. If
some inconsistency is found, the resource will be sync'd with the
latest version in neutron. A OVSDB lock is used for this task as well
to guarantee that only one check is running in the entirely cluster.

The maintenance mechanism runs on its own OVN worker [1] so the OVSDB
lock doesn't conflict with the OVSDB monitor one.

Currently in this patch, only the ``network`` resource is being
addressed to keep it small and easy to review. New resources will be
added on subsequently patches.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/futurist/
[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/networking-ovn/latest/contributor/design/ovn_worker.html

Change-Id: I61757e70460b83b93429ddf4f7792af7cc2d7ab5

commit_message:
Optimize inconsistency detection (Part 2)

This patch is introducing the maintenance mechanism for the database
consistency work.

This new mechanism is based on the futurist library [0].

The ``check_for_incosistencies`` task will compare the
"ovn_revision_numbers" table with the Neutron's "standardattributes" table
and check if there's any difference between the revision numbers. If
some inconsistency is found, the resource will be sync'd with the
latest version in neutron. A OVSDB lock is used for this task as well
to guarantee that only one check is running in the entirely cluster.

The maintenance mechanism runs on its own OVN worker [1] so the OVSDB
lock doesn't conflict with the OVSDB monitor one.

Currently in this patch, only the ``network`` resource is being
addressed to keep it small and easy to review. New resources will be
added on subsequently patches.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/futurist/
[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/networking-ovn/latest/contributor/design/ovn_worker.html

Change-Id: I61757e70460b83b93429ddf4f7792af7cc2d7ab5

commit_message:
Ensure policy file exists

With the move of existing policy.json files into code, the file may no
longer be shipped by packaging. The json augeas lens requires that the
file exist or it fails. This change adds a file resource to ensure the
file exists with a basic json construct prior to managing the contents
with augeas.

Change-Id: I26e8b1384f4f69712da9d06a4c565dfd1f17c9ed
Related-Bug: #1742154

commit_message:
Use a Zaqar queue to get stack events

This adds the ability to use Zaqar to retrieve Heat events instead of polling
the API. It adds a new flag, not using the queue by default.
This is a new attempt after I3b836637d4e72aaf7183dbabf0b0e32c2caa8270 was
reverted.

Change-Id: I6f64cbf96443e8d22803abf9015bcb8a3d958de2

[DO NOT MERGE] Testing upgrade.

Tracking this error:

  Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, Could not find class ::tripleo::profile::base::docker for upstream-centos-7-2-node-rdo-cloud-tripleo-50567-21398.localdomain at /var
/lib/tripleo-config/puppet_step_config.pp:6:1 on node upstream-centos-7-2-node-rdo-cloud-tripleo-50567-21398.localdomain

The first depends on is for having the var/lib/heat-config
The second is to have the proper repo for pike.  If not used we have:

   Not using downloaded delorean/repomd.xml because it is older than what we have:
      Current   : Tue Nov 28 04:56:36 2017
      Downloaded: Wed Nov 22 03:56:44 2017
    http://mirror.dfw.rax.openstack.org:8080/rdo/centos7-pike/deps/latest/repodata/repomd.xml: [Errno 14] HTTP Error 404 - Not Found
    Trying other mirror.
d-o1: Collect /var/lib/docker-puppet.
d-o2: Remove priority from repo.

commit_message:
Changed as per the standard convention set to use "."

When we have to source a script file use . instead of source
For Reference follow below link:
https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

[{'created': '2017-09-28 21:15:02.000000000', 'message': "Avoid RPC call in TemplateResource.get_reference_id()

Most TemplateResources probably don't have an OS::stack_id output defined
in the template, so it's unfortunate that we have to make an RPC call to
check that every time we retrieve the resource's reference_id, which we
have to do for most stack operations.

To cut down on unnecessary RPC calls, check the template first locally to
see if there is an OS::stack_id output present.

commit_message:
Avoid RPC call in TemplateResource.get_reference_id()

Most TemplateResources probably don't have an OS::stack_id output defined
in the template, so it's unfortunate that we have to make an RPC call to
check that every time we retrieve the resource's reference_id, which we
have to do for most stack operations.

To cut down on unnecessary RPC calls, check the template first locally to
see if there is an OS::stack_id output present.

Change-Id: Ia32ed6bca453b391371f544ad0a07d49dc0616e3
Related-Bug: #1719333

commit_message:
Handle unicode when downloading transfer credentials

Since that file contains translatable text, it may include non-ascii
characters, depending on the language used.

Change-Id: I2051e80b74b42c1817c0992f8a52ffe96b3cabc8
Closes-bug: #1742412

commit_message:
Rename '--all-tenants' to '--all-projects'

The python-openstackclient has renamed '--all-tenants' to '--all-projects'.
Zun should do the same for consistent.

Change-Id: I28a9ca18081f88e4742c8c54f092b1be25b9942d
Closes-Bug: #1741642

commit_message:
reset job interval when audit was updated

when we update a existing audit's interval, the interval of
'execute_audit' job is still the old value.
We need to update the interval of 'execute_audit' job.

Change-Id: I402efaa6b2fd3a454717c3df9746c827927ffa91
Closes-Bug: #1738140

commit_message:
check actionplan state when deleting actionplan

If actionplan is 'ONGOING' or 'PENDING',
don't delete it.

Change-Id: I8bfa31a70bba0a7adb1bfd09fc22e6a66b9ebf3a
Closes-Bug: #1738360

commit_message:
Add support for Capsule volume

Capsule now can support attach volume when created.
Also modify the template for the format of volume in
capsule.

User can either create a new volume when launch
the capsule by specify the volume size, or use the existed
available volumes by set the volumeID in the template.

Now the volume could not support multiple attach to
serveral container, just support:
1. one volume attach to one container
2. Several volumes attach to one container

Part of blueprint introduce-compose

Change-Id: I2e2afba94cb83e6e7924366cbd8135fe6d6eea16
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104
Related-Bug: #1732630

Change-Id: If00affa66856d9214ac8880523c551051d8cdb0f

commit_message:
use current weighted sd as min_sd when starting to simulate migrations

If it uses a specific value(usually 1 or 2) as the min_sd when starting
to simulate migrations. The first simulate_migration case will always be
less than the min_sd and come into the solution, even though the migration
will increase the weighted sd. This is unreasonable, and make migrations
among hosts back and forth

Change-Id: I7813c4c92c380c489c349444b85187c5611d9c92
Closes-Bug: #1739723

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104

Change-Id: I378d0c205ecf9ba13aa2b90c89cfe2752fe29027
Related-Bug: #1732630

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104

Change-Id: Ie943adf7b827ddee111faf8e504fe784f211016d
Related-Bug: #1732630

'}]
commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104

Change-Id: Icdd04350a96e00b38e9536e41f1f900804a0dfaa
Related-Bug: #1732630

@Fan Zhang, Sure, If there is no giturl, it will generate one. But the generate one is incorrect. Please check https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L20'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-09 11:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't feel it. Yes, in code there is such field, but I haven't found project using it (searched in nova, neutron, cinder...).
Correct me if I'm wrong but I think this change is not needed."}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-01-11 08:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon this patch because the doc team has a superior solution in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532163'}]

commit_message:
Remove redudant UUID method from migrations

- UUID is generated by models in code by sqlalchemy session
  it's not server default, which means that we don't need to put
  the default value in migrations

Change-Id: I8b527e3d63f66cc8336042b538e64eadf577f89d

[{'created': '2018-01-10 18:41:29.000000000', 'message': "Check container_id when disconnecting its network

The field 'container_id' is not always available (i.e. it is None
if the container failed to create in Docker). We need to check
it before disconnecting this container.

Change-Id: I497a171548b5382abdde29160c43c9f4b10972c6
"}]
commit_message:
Check container_id when disconnecting its network

The field 'container_id' is not always available (i.e. it is None
if the container failed to create in Docker). We need to check
it before disconnecting this container.

Change-Id: I497a171548b5382abdde29160c43c9f4b10972c6

commit_message:
Attempt to guess valid Git URLs

Documentation isn't always located in 'doc/source' - there are also
directories such as 'releasenotes/source', 'api-ref/source',
'api-guide/source'. Take advantage of the conventions of OpenStack and
extract documentation from these directories.

Change-Id: I696619fe6962b9e57cada21b91d58f9d35e78d8c
Closes-Bug: #1732630

commit_message:
Revert "Fix the incorrect git source url"

This reverts commit f0744a16755384732c5f54735d7aba9e5dc5954e.

Manual configuration should be necessary only in the rarest of cases.
Revert this in preparation for a more automated case.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 01:58:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104

Change-Id: I45fb2d770e8915a233c00d353b4d6c8903455cdd
Related-Bug: #1732630
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104

Change-Id: I45fb2d770e8915a233c00d353b4d6c8903455cdd
Related-Bug: #1732630

commit_message:
Update log translations hacking rule

Starting with the Pike series, OpenStack no longer supports log
translation. Update rule to prevent translation at all log levels
instead of only debug level.

Change-Id: I2e72c70eb6abfb4729df880e64cfe508398d4b68

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 18:32:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deployment with public TLS enabled

When deploying with tls enabled in public
endpoints, ansible modules fails due SSL certificates
are self-signed.

This change adds a new variable to allow customization
on which endpoints ansible should connect.
Defaults to admin because admin auth parameters defaults
to admin endpoint.

Change-Id: Ic3ed58cf9c9579cae08a11bbfe6fce983b5a9cbc
Closes-Bug: #1720995
(cherry picked from commit 56374206bebe1a4a3f25e2099cbd839f47ff3a6f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deployment with public TLS enabled

When deploying with tls enabled in public
endpoints, ansible modules fails due SSL certificates
are self-signed.

This change adds a new variable to allow customization
on which endpoints ansible should connect.
Defaults to admin because admin auth parameters defaults
to admin endpoint.

Change-Id: Ic3ed58cf9c9579cae08a11bbfe6fce983b5a9cbc
Closes-Bug: #1720995
(cherry picked from commit 56374206bebe1a4a3f25e2099cbd839f47ff3a6f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 01:01:50.000000000', 'message': "Set max-server to 0 for infracloud-vanilla

We've lost controller00.vanilla.ic.openstack.org due to HDD failure,
for now set max-servers to 0, so we don't boot any nodes.

A fallow up patch will remove infracloud-vanilla complete, as we plan
to collapse the hardware into infracloud-chocolate.

Change-Id: I85d28a6d134b0bd2481d89da488deca625f79bf2
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Set max-server to 0 for infracloud-vanilla

We've lost controller00.vanilla.ic.openstack.org due to HDD failure,
for now set max-servers to 0, so we don't boot any nodes.

A fallow up patch will remove infracloud-vanilla complete, as we plan
to collapse the hardware into infracloud-chocolate.

Change-Id: I85d28a6d134b0bd2481d89da488deca625f79bf2
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-31 18:03:38.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor DB related exceptions

There is no need to create set of similar exceptions for every
record that we have in our database it actually makes life harder:

1) More code
2) More exceptions
3) More places to make mistake
4) Every time question to reuse exceptions or create new one
5) Handling of DB related exceptions becomes very hard

Change-Id: I98a91e05ffd48957767f837bcc24bc7341a7de25
'}, {'created': '2017-12-31 18:44:16.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor DB related exceptions

There is no need to create set of similar exceptions for every
record that we have in our database it actually makes life harder:

1) More code
2) More exceptions
3) More places to make mistake
4) Every time question to reuse exceptions or create new one
5) Handling of DB related exceptions becomes very hard

As well having single tree of exception related to DB makes handling easier:

- DBException (if you want to handle everything related to DB layer)
-- DBConlfict (conflicts with statuses)
-- DBRecrodNotFound (if record was not found)
-- DBRecrodExists (if unique constraints fails)

Change-Id: I98a91e05ffd48957767f837bcc24bc7341a7de25

-- DBConlfict (conflicts with statuses)
-- DBRecrodNotFound (if record was not found)

'}, {'created': '2017-12-31 20:42:55.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor DB related exceptions

There is no need to create set of similar exceptions for every
record that we have in our database it actually makes life harder:

1) More code
2) More exceptions
3) More places to make mistake
4) Every time question to reuse exceptions or create new one
5) Handling of DB related exceptions becomes very hard

As well having single tree of exception related to DB makes handling easier:

- DBException (if you want to handle everything related to DB layer)
-- DBConlfict (conflicts with statuses)
-- DBRecrodNotFound (if record was not found)
-- DBRecrodExists (if unique constraints fails)

Deleted Exceptions:

- TaskNotFound(NotFoundException)
- DeploymentNotFound(NotFoundException)
- DeploymentNameExists(RallyException)
- DeploymentIsBusy(RallyException)
- ResourceNotFound(NotFoundException)
- TaskInvalidStatus(RallyException)
- WorkerNotFound(NotFoundException)
- WorkerAlreadyRegistered

4) Every time question to reuse exceptions or create new one
5) Handling of DB related exceptions becomes very hard

As well having single tree of exception related to DB makes handling easier:

- DBException (if you want to handle everything related to DB layer)
-- DBConlfict (conflicts with statuses)
-- DBRecrodNotFound (if record was not found)
-- DBRecrodExists (if unique constraints fails)

Deleted Exceptions:

- TaskNotFound(NotFoundException)
- DeploymentNotFound(NotFoundException)
- DeploymentNameExists(RallyException)
- DeploymentIsBusy(RallyException)
- ResourceNotFound(NotFoundException)
- TaskInvalidStatus(RallyException)
- WorkerNotFound(NotFoundException)
- WorkerAlreadyRegistered

Change-Id: I98a91e05ffd48957767f837bcc24bc7341a7de25

commit_message:
Refactor DB related exceptions

There is no need to create set of similar exceptions for every
record that we have in our database it actually makes life harder:

1) More code
2) More exceptions
3) More places to make mistake
4) Every time question to reuse exceptions or create new one
5) Handling of DB related exceptions becomes very hard

As well having single tree of exception related to DB makes handling easier:

- DBException (if you want to handle everything related to DB layer)
-- DBConlfict (conflicts with statuses)
-- DBRecrodNotFound (if record was not found)
-- DBRecrodExists (if unique constraints fails)

Deleted Exceptions:

- TaskNotFound(NotFoundException)
- DeploymentNotFound(NotFoundException)
- DeploymentNameExists(RallyException)
- DeploymentIsBusy(RallyException)
- ResourceNotFound(NotFoundException)
- TaskInvalidStatus(RallyException)

Change-Id: I98a91e05ffd48957767f837bcc24bc7341a7de25

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 01:00:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a typo in the test HTTP server

The test HTTP server code we use for testing had a typo where the the cookie
inserted was "JESSIONID" instead of "JSESSIONID". This led to confusion
and failing tempest tests. This patch changes it to "JSESSIONID" to avoid
confusion.

Change-Id: I5d1f5fb82c6bd399446f2ad9788541bb8871c781
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a typo in the test HTTP server

The test HTTP server code we use for testing had a typo where the the cookie
inserted was "JESSIONID" instead of "JSESSIONID". This led to confusion
and failing tempest tests. This patch changes it to "JSESSIONID" to avoid
confusion.

Change-Id: I5d1f5fb82c6bd399446f2ad9788541bb8871c781

commit_message:
Switch grafana neutron board to non-legacy jobs

Some jobs are still legacy:
- periodics
- tempest-py35

We will switch those to new jobs once they are available.

Change-Id: I5f7cc7d33c37ebde58e455077b7bb98a7852d4db

commit_message:
Pass headers to httpclient

Right now, it is impossible to set HTTP headers in client because
the 'headers' parameter is not set. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Iff002aaca516e8d014074f120b7f713758ebf265
Partial-Bug: #1737473

commit_message:

magnum_ui/static/dashboard/container-infra/cluster-templates/cluster-templates.scss

Also, remove ineffective styles for batch actions.

Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu-mutou@rf.jp.nec.com>

This seems really corner case (only for unicode) and I think this kind of tests should be operated on each project repo except Tempest which is an integration test suite for whole OpenStack projects.
Now cinder repo owns Tempest tests for its specific usage under cinder/tests/tempest/api/volume. How about implementing this test in cinder?'}, {'account_id': 25456, 'date': '2018-01-11 02:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)

> This seems really corner case (only for unicode) and I think this
 > kind of tests should be operated on each project repo except
 > Tempest which is an integration test suite for whole OpenStack
 > projects.
 > Now cinder repo owns Tempest tests for its specific usage under
 > cinder/tests/tempest/api/volume. How about implementing this test
 > in cinder?

Yes, make sense, tempest is an integration test suite, while cinder-tempest-plugin is for cinder test only. I will move this test to cinder-tempest-plugin.'}, {'account_id': 25456, 'date': '2018-01-11 06:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

will remove this patch to cinder-tempest-plugin.'}]

commit_message:
Add tests for name and desc with unicode symbols

Since cinder api support create, update, list volume with
unicode symbols, so add test case for volume create, update,
list with unicode values.

Change-Id: I8586bbf30d330ffb1cd63a76106c2793255f8da4

commit_message:
Make plan_name configurable for config_download_deploy

Currently this relies on the hard-coded defaults in
tripleo-ansible-inventory, which means --config-download will break
with any non-default --stack option.

A similar fix is required to tripleoclient to pass this value.

Change-Id: I31cf062b28429be41e266745ade93be1e6c51b0f

commit_message:
Convert ansible action to TripleoInventory class

This no longer needs to exect the tripleo-ansible-inventory script,
as we moved the class which generates the inventory to tripleo-common.

Note this also adds a missing cacert argument, which probably fixes
a bug when tls is enabled as previously it wasn't included in the
environment variables.

Change-Id: I6ece23ce074fb58177d426bf4123836adec21f63

commit_message:
Remove 10 minutes reserved for logs for multinode

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527844/ is merged
we don't need to save 10 minutes for logs anymore.
Remove this time from timeout command for quickstart running.

Change-Id: If60280ca19a2ed8d4730f605f5ce9114c907f9ec

commit_message:
Enable automatic restart of memcached, apache and mongodb

Prior to Newton, HA deployments had automatic restart of non-Openstack
services on controller nodes. From Newton onward, after we switched to
systemd for the vast majority of services, Openstack services are
configured for automatic restart, but memcached apache and mongodb
lack it.

Generate a drop-in file for the mentioned services, so they can
restart automatically in both HA and non-HA deployments.

Change-Id: I8576db193b358cf804e8aaeb0e05b31c635ae5ba
Closes-Bug: #1741263

commit_message:
Use relative path in ipv6 nic configs

The path to run-os-net-config.sh in these nic config templates for ci
should be relative, not absolute. The absolute path does not honor a
different directory specified via --templates, and it also fails the
overcloud deploy entirely b/c the absolute path does not exist in the
plan in swift.

Change-Id: I85ac081571965f42beef4bd283db985b9a03078f
(cherry picked from commit c74318381c91751e0f43f1b99f26011cecafe440)
(cherry picked from commit c6404c9b47d8344665a308ce92bb7e4f859141cd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 16:59:53.000000000', 'message': "Start using nic-configs from THT repo instead of tripleo-ci

This patch uses the net-iso gen tool to create multi-nic network
isolation templates with the same settings we currently use in CI.
Rather than overwrite existing example configs in the network dir,
we instead create a new dir under ci/environments to hold the
nic-configs we use in CI jobs. This alleviates any concerns about
backwards-compatibility and breaking users on upgrade.

We may want to also consider a massive cleanup of the existing
network dir with a proper deprecation period, but that is an
exercise left for later.

By moving these nic-configs to THT, we are bringing them inline
with the other heat environments we have moved out of the CI repo.
It also allows an end user to start from a configuration that we
have actually CI'd (though there are some settings like MTU that
are not actually good for a real deployment).

Change-Id: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff
(cherry picked from commit 10b749c043700369d4ea89d5a238173c4dde1d7e)
(cherry picked from commit f09e6acefd93b800e275131a3712f905bf4e3aa5)
"}]
commit_message:
Start using nic-configs from THT repo instead of tripleo-ci

This patch uses the net-iso gen tool to create multi-nic network
isolation templates with the same settings we currently use in CI.
Rather than overwrite existing example configs in the network dir,
we instead create a new dir under ci/environments to hold the
nic-configs we use in CI jobs. This alleviates any concerns about
backwards-compatibility and breaking users on upgrade.

We may want to also consider a massive cleanup of the existing
network dir with a proper deprecation period, but that is an
exercise left for later.

By moving these nic-configs to THT, we are bringing them inline
with the other heat environments we have moved out of the CI repo.
It also allows an end user to start from a configuration that we
have actually CI'd (though there are some settings like MTU that
are not actually good for a real deployment).

Change-Id: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff
(cherry picked from commit 10b749c043700369d4ea89d5a238173c4dde1d7e)
(cherry picked from commit f09e6acefd93b800e275131a3712f905bf4e3aa5)

commit_message:
Start using ipv6 nic-configs from THT repo instead of tripleo-ci

This patch uses the net-iso gen tool to create ipv6 multi-nic network
isolation templates with the same settings we currently use in CI.
Rather than overwrite existing example configs in the network dir,
we instead create a new dir under ci/environments to hold the
nic-configs we use in CI jobs. This alleviates any concerns about
backwards-compatibility and breaking users on upgrade.

By moving these nic-configs to THT, we are bringing them inline
with the other heat environments we have moved out of the CI repo.
It also allows an end user to start from a configuration that we
have actually CI'd.

Change-Id: Iba56667e11510a1cc2470a7dfdc6bc0158878010
(cherry picked from commit 3fc4da76ab0970b6cc2a2648d1908158fa0fcc02)
(cherry picked from commit 7232568a267622a15eeef663978e0650a8ea1f85)

commit_message:
kernel: allow to override modules & sysctl settings

Allow to easily personalize Kernel modules and sysctl settings with two new parameters.
ExtraKernelModules and ExtraSysctlSettings are dictionaries that will take precedence
over the defaults settings provided in the composable service.

Closes-Bug: #1742440
Change-Id: I9cd43331e5e9a6074cd47040c29815ca32c61693

Migrate to override_role for image module (part 1)

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the image module
for 4 files.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

commit_message:
Add parameters to configure options in keystone's security_compliance group

These parameters were introduced as strings and will only be configured
if the value is set. This way it respects the $::os_service_default
settings which is the default for all of them.

Depends-On: I089f2e28cce2688ed080096c88ab539393627cfb
Change-Id: I3399129c41054a914bb91417c814cd063ee0c07e

* use the openstack-heat-agents package to install all of the

commit_message:
Replace deprecated packages installation

Fix undercloud deploy references to the deprecated packages:

* openstack-puppet-modules is deprecated, use puppet-tripleo instead
* use the openstack-heat-agents package to install all of the
  python-heat-agent packages, instead of having to specify
  each individually
  (follows-up I72caf6ff0dfa3f164737b92e89c1cc6043845864)

Change-Id: I3d7258415723143741b9059b73e2cc0dab870fa0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Limit runtime of logs collection

When logs collection runs in post playbook we need to limit it in
time to prevent it being stuck and prolong job for hours.

Change-Id: I6b9418a2020df74b07fbb6c6b00ada0ce1706878

commit_message:
Add DockerPuppetDebug to environments/config-debug.yaml

This enables puppet debug for puppet containers as well when
an operator includes environments/config-debug.yaml which is
the 'traditional' way we've been using to enable puppet debugging.

Change-Id: I4b9e2a2169572f679f7c0e357349264d7e0a8a50

subject: Migrate to override_role for network tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 27622, 'date': '2018-01-10 12:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-10 12:31:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-01-10 17:45:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-01-10 21:24:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks! LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 23185, 'date': '2018-01-10 22:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

Migrate to override_role for network tests

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the network module
for 3 files.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

commit_message:
Fixed Dell EMC VMax driver parameter typo

There's a typo in the "name =>" of the pywbem package. The variable name
must start with $::cinder::params. Without this the controller's logs
show the variable not found.

Change-Id: I6bc92d1c200c963602f3f8a29a7bf5dc5b4f7737

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 04:50:43.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Dont install python-pip for py3k"

This reverts commit ab89c7d69c6bba6a6e394ff7a4ae520268bb2b16.

This commit checked for DIB_PYTHON_VERSION and only installed the v3
packages.  This is unfortunately backwards-incompatible, as consumers
such as the openstack gate are relying on this package installing pip
& virtualenv packages for python2 AND python3.

This was sort-of expressed in the docs, where it discusses what the
resulting setup of the system will be, but I've added a note to make
it clearer.

If we want to change this, I think we'll need either a new element, or
a non-defaulting flag.

Change-Id: I419dbdf4682394db68974944af1e5c432f3e0565
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Dont install python-pip for py3k"

This reverts commit ab89c7d69c6bba6a6e394ff7a4ae520268bb2b16.

This commit checked for DIB_PYTHON_VERSION and only installed the v3
packages.  This is unfortunately backwards-incompatible, as consumers
such as the openstack gate are relying on this package installing pip
& virtualenv packages for python2 AND python3.

This was sort-of expressed in the docs, where it discusses what the
resulting setup of the system will be, but I've added a note to make
it clearer.

If we want to change this, I think we'll need either a new element, or
a non-defaulting flag.

Change-Id: I419dbdf4682394db68974944af1e5c432f3e0565

commit_message:
Test size extend for an attached volume

This tests a new Cinder microversion to allow extending
the size of an attached volume.

Once the volume is extended in the storage backend, the
Cinder volume manager will call a new microversion in
Nova to let Nova complete the operation for the server
instance that is attached to the volume.

The test initiates the operation through the Cinder API
and then monitors the Nova API until completion.

Related to cinder blueprint extend-attached-volume
Related to nova blueprint nova-support-attached-volume-extend

Change-Id: Ibace6c2f91be9753a44e5f79fd013df11654851b
Depends-On: I60c8ea9eb0bbcfe41f5f0a30ed8dc67bdcab3ebc

subject: Add Volumes tab for container creation
messages:
[{'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-12-12 10:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-12-15 09:39:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Shu,

I was able to create container with volumes by using the Volumes tab, which is great. However, I am not sure why I got this error whenever I tried to add a volume: https://s2.postimg.org/yj1cr622h/Untitled.png . Do you know what happened?'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-12-26 08:55:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Hongbin, I could not reproduce the error for now. If you found the steps how to reproduce the error, could you let me the steps?'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-12-26 08:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-12-27 13:09:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-12-27 13:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Hi Shu,
 > 
 > I was able to create container with volumes by using the Volumes
 > tab, which is great. However, I am not sure why I got this error
 > whenever I tried to add a volume: https://s2.postimg.org/yj1cr622h/Untitled.png
 > . Do you know what happened?

I used Firefox to test this patch

* Click "Create Container"
* Click "Volumes" in the left panel
* Fill the form with arbitrary "Type", "Source", "Size", "Destination"
* Click "Add Volume"

Then, I saw there is an error saying "Danger: There was an error submitting the form ..." .
Open the firefox debugger, I saw there is a request as following

  POST http://172.24.5.11/dashboard/project/container/containers/ [HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden 769ms]'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-12-27 13:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Hi Hongbin, I could not reproduce the error for now. If you found
 > the steps how to reproduce the error, could you let me the steps?

I mentioned the steps in another reply. It looks the dashboard magically submit the form to "dashboard/project/container/containers/" when I clicked the "Add Volume" button. I tried to figure out why but I couldn't..'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-01-10 07:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

I found the difference of behavior between chrome and firefox. Firefox seems to be bubling click event unexpectedly. So when we click "Add Volume" button, the form submit immediately if the form is valid. Therefore I prevented the click event propagation.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-01-10 07:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

>   POST http://172.24.5.11/dashboard/project/container/containers/ [HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden 769ms]

Our panel never post to this path [/dashboard/project/container/containers/]. I could not find the reason for this now. Can you try recent Horizon on master branch?'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-01-10 07:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-10 16:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-10 16:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Hi Shu,

The new patchset worked very well for me. Nice job! While I was testing this patch, I found another issue that is unrelated to this patch:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun-ui/+bug/1742477

Also, there is a bug in Zun server side that prevents the new volume creation to work properly:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1740942

These two issues can be fixed later.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-10 16:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> >   POST http://172.24.5.11/dashboard/project/container/containers/
 > [HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden 769ms]
 > 
 > Our panel never post to this path [/dashboard/project/container/containers/].
 > I could not find the reason for this now. Can you try recent
 > Horizon on master branch?

After you stopped the event propagation, this request disappeared.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-10 18:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> >   POST http://172.24.5.11/dashboard/project/container/containers/
 > [HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden 769ms]
 > 
 > Our panel never post to this path [/dashboard/project/container/containers/].
 > I could not find the reason for this now. Can you try recent
 > Horizon on master branch?

I tried recent Horizon on master branch with patchset #2. It looks the issue was gone.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-01-11 01:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hongbin, thank you for your reviewing and feedback!! I will fix the bug you filed.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-01-11 01:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Fix url error about showing API v2 details

1 when using the url "/v2", it will receiving the "302 Found".
For showing API v2 details, it should have a '/' behind.
2 Update version-show-response.json

Change-Id: I349999a24da7d2a934d3d92eb82c0e6d59734619

Change-Id: I1be0c45529dbec2f8c2da5658f775e2cdee35111

commit_message:
ironic: run valid test in whitelist

ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.api.admin.test_drivers is the new namespace
of the test when running with the tempest plugin.
This will re-activate the Tempest tests for Ironic witht he new plugin.

Depends-On: Iddd38ccf9bee8de4eced61c72a63e274c753ac32
Change-Id: I1be0c45529dbec2f8c2da5658f775e2cdee35111

commit_message:
placement: extract traits from flavor extra spec

This patch extracts traits from flavor extra spec, sends traits to
allocation candidates endopoint to filter resource providers.

Implements: blueprint request-traits-in-nova
Change-Id: Ida3dca1f6cffa6ff136e7b100d717f7b44bd11a6

subject: Ignore case for bootstrap node checks
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 21:42:34.000000000', 'message': "Ignore case for bootstrap node checks

The bootstrap_nodeid can have capital letters while the hostname may
not. In puppet we use downcase for this comparison, so let's follow a
similar pattern for scripts from THT.

Change-Id: I8a0bec4a6f3ed0b4f2289cbe7023344fb284edf7
Closes-Bug: #16998201
(cherry picked from commit d077b8735c159ad77bb7c9cd5a1733ae83f3d32e)

commit_message:
Ignore case for bootstrap node checks

The bootstrap_nodeid can have capital letters while the hostname may
not. In puppet we use downcase for this comparison, so let's follow a
similar pattern for scripts from THT.

Note: this backport also modify the Newton specific bits.

Change-Id: I8a0bec4a6f3ed0b4f2289cbe7023344fb284edf7
Closes-Bug: #16998201
(cherry picked from commit d077b8735c159ad77bb7c9cd5a1733ae83f3d32e)

commit_message:
Ignore case for bootstrap node checks

The bootstrap_nodeid can have capital letters while the hostname may
not. In puppet we use downcase for this comparison, so let's follow a
similar pattern for scripts from THT.

Change-Id: I8a0bec4a6f3ed0b4f2289cbe7023344fb284edf7
Closes-Bug: #16998201
(cherry picked from commit abf4444d90b6f01342938ad0684e55678fa3b579)

commit_message:
Add Octavia API endpoint to haproxy

This patch adds an endpoint for Octavia API to haproxy.

Closes-Bug: #1728589

Change-Id: I978b83fa5f3900d2f09c2affc59e90e150a42892

commit_message:
Adding mongodb support to xenial

Changes to add support for mongodb for xenial to trove/integration.
The schema is the same proposed by Doug Shelley in the initial
work, splitting trusty and xenial.

- bumped version to 3.2.11
- conversion of upstart files in systemd unit files for mongod and
mongos
- added oneshot systemd unit file for Transparent Huge Pages
- added script to check if numactl is used by the system and oneshot
systemd unit file that will generate an environment file for mongod
systemd service

Change-Id: Ie6492b24f6803b35d929b499cfb7716e28bebfaa
Depends-On: I8e1de6ef31f969ccee88c334a0d5ed03aabd1b51

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-13 16:22:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ironic_tempest_plugin/ directory

We now use the project openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin to store our
tempest plugin. All content from the ironic_tempest_plugin/ directory
has been ported to that project.

We no longer want to have the plugin content stored here so we delete
it.

Change-Id: I700bd7b71472fa91f6bc02aebc055584df08e0ef

commit_message:
Remove ironic_tempest_plugin/ directory

We now use the project openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin to store our
tempest plugin. All content from the ironic_tempest_plugin/ directory
has been ported to that project.

We no longer want to have the plugin content stored here so we delete
it.

Remove check in tools/flake8wrap.sh that prevented changes to the
ironic_tempest_plugin/ directory.

Change-Id: I700bd7b71472fa91f6bc02aebc055584df08e0ef

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for network tests-2

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the network module
for 3 modules.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

This commit fixes weird indentations in the documentation. And this
commit also adds auto generated file `patrole.conf.sample` to
.gitignore because we don't need to manage it in a git repository.

commit_message:
Use doc/requirements.txt

The infra jobs expect documentation requirements in either
doc/requirements.txt or test-requirements.txt. Since neither is
available, they currently fail.

Move doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt and use that to
fix releasenotes build. Note that doc/requirements.txt needs some
requirements for code analysis of taskflow.

For the docs environment - which is a developer convenience - use the
same command that is used by OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: Iec65211e5059a4afdd88a45e2c1ac535b8ec97fe
(cherry picked from commit 760f4414eae8fb484f4abeaee454847261228f5c)
(cherry picked from commit a42df9c4978372c9ba1bdced14dee878f3a624b1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 20:23:42.000000000', 'message': "Add python_exec kwarg to processutils.execute()

This commit adds a new kwarg to the process_utils.execute() function to
specify the python executable to use when launching python to check
prlimits. This is necessary when processutils.execute() is called from
inside an API server running with uwsgi. In this case sys.executable is
uwsgi (because uwsgi links libpython.so and is actually the interpreter)
This doesn't work with the execute() function because it assumes the
cpython interpreter CLI is used for the arguments it uses to call the
prlimits module. To workaround this and enable API servers that may run
under uwsgi to use this those applications can simply pass in an
executable to use.

Longer term it might be better to migrate the prlimits usage to call
multiprocessing instead of subprocessing python. But that would require
a more significant rewrite of both processutils and prlimit to
facilitate that.

Change-Id: I0ae60f0b4cc3700c783f6018e837358f0e053a09
Closes-Bug: #1712463
"}, {'created': '2018-01-06 00:17:12.000000000', 'message': "Add python_exec kwarg to processutils.execute()

commit_message:
Add python_exec kwarg to processutils.execute()

This commit adds a new kwarg to the process_utils.execute() function to
specify the python executable to use when launching python to check
prlimits. This is necessary when processutils.execute() is called from
inside an API server running with uwsgi. In this case sys.executable is
uwsgi (because uwsgi links libpython.so and is actually the interpreter)
This doesn't work with the execute() function because it assumes the
cpython interpreter CLI is used for the arguments it uses to call the
prlimits module. To workaround this and enable API servers that may run
under uwsgi to use this those applications can simply pass in an
executable to use.

Longer term it might be better to migrate the prlimits usage to call
multiprocessing instead of subprocessing python. But that would require
a more significant rewrite of both processutils and prlimit to
facilitate that.

Change-Id: I0ae60f0b4cc3700c783f6018e837358f0e053a09
Closes-Bug: #1712463

subject: Remove metric service
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 23:59:20.000000000', 'message': "Remove metric service

There is discussion on the mailing list about ceilometerclient removal.

This is a patch to remove the metric service. It's here to be a place
where we can discuss and decide which direction we'd like to go.

On the one hand, it's a REST API so there is no need for us to not
support it. As a general rule removing support for services that we have
is a bad thing.

On the other hand, we haven't cut the 1.0 yet, and as ceilometer doesn't
exist anymore we can't really do devstack testing of it. It's already
special-cased in the Connection constructor because it doesn't exist in
the service types authority, so if there was ever a time to get rid of
it, that time is now.

On the third hand, at least heat, aodh, rally and mistral are using
ceilometer client in some manner, so keeping it here could provide an
option for them if they wanted to keep ceilometer support for some
reason.

Change-Id: Ieb4d67a5ced11f5164fa3b8c1fe7a39f74f7fa6b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove metric service

There is discussion on the mailing list about ceilometerclient removal.

This is a patch to remove the metric service. It's here to be a place
where we can discuss and decide which direction we'd like to go.

On the one hand, it's a REST API so there is no need for us to not
support it. As a general rule removing support for services that we have
is a bad thing.

On the other hand, we haven't cut the 1.0 yet, and as ceilometer doesn't
exist anymore we can't really do devstack testing of it. It's already
special-cased in the Connection constructor because it doesn't exist in
the service types authority, so if there was ever a time to get rid of
it, that time is now.

On the third hand, at least heat, aodh, rally and mistral are using
ceilometer client in some manner, so keeping it here could provide an
option for them if they wanted to keep ceilometer support for some
reason.

Change-Id: Ieb4d67a5ced11f5164fa3b8c1fe7a39f74f7fa6b

commit_message:
Add Permission for k8s plugin in fluent-logging

This PS adds permissions for k8s plugin in fluent-logging.
The k8s plugin in fluentbit gets information per pod and adds it to the
message(log) before output. But the plugin cannot get the pod in current chart.
This PS fix this issue.

Change-Id: Icdce8a0a5ed0975c4d6e72ba50df8ef9a3b76ca6

commit_message:
Add _query_mapping to identity resources

The parent commit added _query_mapping to Project and User classes
to address the bug on 'domain' filtering.
Other identity resources also support filtering.
This commit adds query parameters to the other resources.

Change-Id: I87783c8244df47775e417151d825b75d39f30be3
Related-Bug: #1739929

commit_message:
Allow to pass filters like domain to find_project/user

In multi-domain environments, project names or user names can be same
across domains. To retrieve a single project/user, we need to pass
domain information to find_project/find_user.

This commit defines _query_mapping to Project and User classes
and adds filtering parameters to find_project/find_user in _proxy.py.
The required field for filtering is 'domain_id' only, but it might be
useful to allow to pass other filtering fields.

Closes-Bug: #1739929
Needed-By: I8f59fa3f9b7c573485cd1572e5e9aae08f071e37
Change-Id: I60a8b3b83f6170b60d09c101b5c7035148283678

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 20:19:52.000000000', 'message': "Switched from q-dns to neutron-dns service name

The q-* service names make devstack use old lib/neutron-legacy library
to configure neutron services. We plan to swith to the new lib/neutron
library, and it's a requirement that no services with q-* names are
present in ENABLED_SERVICES to make it happen.

The neutron devstack plugin handles both names identically, so there
should be no functional change after the patch is merged.

Change-Id: Ic5100cd2f12b729149350e3ccb0aba7844b18d2c
"}]
commit_message:
Switched from q-dns to neutron-dns service name

The q-* service names make devstack use old lib/neutron-legacy library
to configure neutron services. We plan to swith to the new lib/neutron
library, and it's a requirement that no services with q-* names are
present in ENABLED_SERVICES to make it happen.

The neutron devstack plugin handles both names identically, so there
should be no functional change after the patch is merged.

Change-Id: Ic5100cd2f12b729149350e3ccb0aba7844b18d2c

commit_message:
Add group to policy management

The move of policy.json into code means the file may not exist. We've
added support to ensure that the file exists in the openstacklib but we
need to make sure the permissions are right for each service. This adds
the group information to the policies so it works right.

Depends-On: I26e8b1384f4f69712da9d06a4c565dfd1f17c9ed
Change-Id: I132c47f2b692ca7fb7a01326f958fa35e9d2a6db
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add group to policy management

The move of policy.json into code means the file may not exist. We've
added support to ensure that the file exists in the openstacklib but we
need to make sure the permissions are right for each service. This adds
the group information to the policies so it works right.

Depends-On: I26e8b1384f4f69712da9d06a4c565dfd1f17c9ed
Change-Id: I7ed73dd6b898e5f5f25b50f0aaa69b2a1f89644d
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-21 00:53:29.000000000', 'message': 'Allow regumer users to specify VNIC type for port

VNIC type needs to be specified when creating a server with an SR-IOV
port. In this case, a user first creates a port with vnic_type=direct
and creates a server with the created port. To allow this scenario,
horizon needs to allow this.

This commit also clean up the code duplication on the port security and
mac state fields in the port create form. The code in the admin form for
them are completely duplicated with that in the project form.

Change-Id: Ib6e91ed7f720e2720994025429da0dcef2fa4e25
Closes-Bug: #1402959

commit_message:
Allow regular users to specify VNIC type for port

VNIC type needs to be specified when creating a server with an SR-IOV
port. In this case, a user first creates a port with vnic_type=direct
and creates a server with the created port. To allow this scenario,
horizon needs to allow users to specify VNIC type for port.

This commit also clean up the code duplication on the port security and
mac state fields in the port create form. The code in the admin form for
them are completely duplicated with that in the project form.

Change-Id: Ib6e91ed7f720e2720994025429da0dcef2fa4e25
Closes-Bug: #1402959

commit_message:
Remove mox from requirements

Mox was listed in test-requirements, but it is not actually
used anywhere. Since we want to get rid of this package in
OpenStack, removing from requirements so it does not look
like it is being used.

Change-Id: I066ed8b65e76c41548b1e47b152a67701ba3d4d9

commit_message:
Port wait_for_ methods to use iterate_timeout

shade has a function called iterate_timeout which is used to, you
guessed it, iterate until a timeout is met. Update wait_for_status and
wait_for_deleted to use iterate_timeout.

While doing that, shift iterate_timeout to be in openstack.utils.

An attempt was made at shifting the parameter names of wait_for_ and
iterate_timeout to align, but aligning in both directions reads wrong.
wait_for_server with wait and interval reads well. iterate_timeout with
timeout and wait reads well. I think consistency is just going to have
to take a back seat to flow on this one.

Change-Id: Ida691638b57ff6d41b0a9e066a180b79b20642e9

[{'created': '2018-01-07 17:00:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add function to make CloudRegion from session

In cases where a user already has a Session that they're happy with,
making a Connection to wrap it should be quite easy. The only settings
that are needed are Adapter level settings, and all of those have sane
defaults and don't actually need to be set.

Add a factory function that can be used in those cases.

Also, while we're in there, make CloudRegion use the word "region_name"
like everyone else.

This removes the get_region_name method that we added originally to occ in an
early attempt to support openstacksdk. However, nothing in the data
model makes sense if one service has one region_name and another service
has another region_name. Connection is a connection to a region of a
cloud.

commit_message:
Add function to make CloudRegion from session

In cases where a user already has a Session that they're happy with,
making a Connection to wrap it should be quite easy. The only settings
that are needed are Adapter level settings, and all of those have sane
defaults and don't actually need to be set.

Add a factory function that can be used in those cases.

Also, while we're in there, make CloudRegion use the word "region_name"
like everyone else.

This removes the get_region_name method that we added originally to occ in an
early attempt to support openstacksdk. However, nothing in the data
model makes sense if one service has one region_name and another service
has another region_name. Connection is a connection to a region of a
cloud.

Change-Id: I52fde4df188fc2747776c4b65bc7ae68c6e82f06

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 01:16:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a typo in the test HTTP server

The test HTTP server code we use for testing had a typo where the the cookie
inserted was "JESSIONID" instead of "JSESSIONID". This led to confusion
and failing tempest tests. This patch changes it to "JSESSIONID" to avoid
confusion.

Change-Id: I7d6387c71ed96edead3a6a2338b0c78250d4c50d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a typo in the test HTTP server

The test HTTP server code we use for testing had a typo where the the cookie
inserted was "JESSIONID" instead of "JSESSIONID". This led to confusion
and failing tempest tests. This patch changes it to "JSESSIONID" to avoid
confusion.

Change-Id: I7d6387c71ed96edead3a6a2338b0c78250d4c50d

commit_message:
Remove mox from requirements

Mox was listed in test-requirements, but it is not actually
being used anywhere. Since we are trying to remove this
package from OpenStack, removing from requirements so it
doesn't look like it is being used.

Change-Id: I841b1390208c38a9b2b92ff599245555cb6c8d63

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 12:35:42.000000000', 'message': 'Redirect VM console dynamically

Previously when a user accesses the network topology panel
horizon resolves VM console URL when returning server data.
This requires one API call to nova per VM, and this causes
a scaling issue.

Actually there is no need to resolves VM console URL when
the network topology. A console URL corresponding to a requested
VM can be resolved when a user actually accesses a console.
This reduces the number of API calls drastically and addresses
the scaling issue reported in the bug report.

Change-Id: Icc667449e2988e6227012a6e899835a97ce0d738
Closes-Bug: #1723142
(cherry picked from commit 974f0418efdf171132747ded4a556df7b7af03d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Redirect VM console dynamically

Previously when a user accesses the network topology panel
horizon resolves VM console URL when returning server data.
This requires one API call to nova per VM, and this causes
a scaling issue.

Actually there is no need to resolves VM console URL when
the network topology. A console URL corresponding to a requested
VM can be resolved when a user actually accesses a console.
This reduces the number of API calls drastically and addresses
the scaling issue reported in the bug report.

Change-Id: Icc667449e2988e6227012a6e899835a97ce0d738
Closes-Bug: #1723142
(cherry picked from commit 974f0418efdf171132747ded4a556df7b7af03d1)

commit_message:
Cleaned up the requirements of Ironic Tempest plugin

* Removed unnecessary test-requirements since tempest plugin
  contains integration tests not unit tests.

Change-Id: If1c32967b5aafc70840861b28639fee3e9a03561

(4 comments)

So good news, seems we are all aligned on the big picture things here.

We already have a spec that details the plans around using serialised os-vif objects as the nova/neutron interchange format, which is a big part of why os-vif was built in the way it currently has been.

Now that adds a dependency, we can only do negotiation based around os-vif supported plugins, currently only ovs and bridge. But I think that is all part of Neutron choosing to "ignore" the types Nova requested, and Nova is responsible for deciding if it just fails the build and deletes the port, if things have gone badly.

Anyways, that detail should all fall out when we agree on using os-vif as the interchange format.'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2016-11-06 00:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2016-11-14 20:38:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

this has been around in some form or another since at least the paris summit. it would be nice to get this one over the line.

to echo John Garbutt's comment I do think we are all agreed on the broad strokes. my preferences lie with exchanging serialised verioned object vs the plainstrings but i think compatibility across receses and upgrades has been well adressed so either option would work. 

To integrate os-vif with neutron and get to the point where neutron and nova only exchange versioned object we will need a protocol like this one.

the nameing of the class asisde the HostPluginInfo class contains much of the infomation that would be useful to exchange with neutron does its encapsulating HostInfo class though they may need to be extendered or ammended. for example i think it would make sense to extend the HostVIFInfo to also include a list of supported VIFPortProfile object.
https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/master/os_vif/objects/vif.py#L153-L194"}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2016-11-15 18:27:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Two options:

1. we use versioned object and we make os-vif the owner and manager of those objects.
2. we use straight structured-data REsT and we make it the responsibility of the service.

I'll take either.  Note that Nova's virt driver (and not os-vif or the vif type) has to determine if a VIF type is available because it's hypervisor and context specific.  Note that Neutron's mech driver or plugin (and again not os-vif and its bits) need to determine which VIF type will actually be used.  But os-vif can define the negotiation and a call to it could return the classes or class names that are available for the upper level to prune down.

As Sean says, this is long past the point we should have sorted it, and we have two days to get it approved, so propose changes or edit the spec yourselves to get it over the line."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2016-11-16 09:07:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Option 2 there is a waste of time as you just end up having to invent a custom serialization format, which in all likelihood will be worse than the oslo.versionedobjects serialization format'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2016-11-16 16:02:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > invent a custom serialization format, which in all likelihood will

(15 comments)

-1 only for doco fixes. In general, I'm in support of this ide"}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2017-02-22 14:17:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Discussed in the joint session at the PTG.  It seems that the best way forward is to move on with os-vif integration in Neutron first, then use the object type + version as the negotiating parameter during binding.  There was also some talk of whether it made more sense to use another endpoint (an extension endpoint) rather than /ports/ for the bind and unbind process; aside from this, it was recommended that we use a Neutron extension to indicate the presence of this functionality, though noted that this is not essential - per the spec's description - to achieve backward compatibility."}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2017-02-22 15:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-03-06 14:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

formatting aside i think we reached a general agreement that this should be done at the PTG.

for the os-vif changes we can use RFE bugs to track the work items in launchpad. i would like to get a poc working for pike 1 where we can workout the details of the neutron extension and nova changes and target pike 2 for up streaming the final version.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-20 14:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(16 comments)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-20 14:53:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I am trying to think of the best way we can make progress, ideally this cycle.

This is what I was expecting to happen:

* extend os-vif so host_info(...) so it can: only include things are acceptable to the users request, only include things are acceptable on the given host and with the given instance.
* ensure we have enough os-vif plugins for the vhostuser negotiation
* agree Neuton API changes somewhere, so Nova can start sending information (ideally detecting via an extension if the call out of os-vif is needed)
* (so far, no need for a Nova spec approval)
* (nova) supply a list of what objects we know about, after os-vif having trimmed down the list to smaller amount, ordered as a preference order?
* (neutron) starts supplying os-vif based binding, where possible, it falls back to old style info if that isn't suitable

It seems like the best way to make progress is agree the API changes on the neutron side, to specify the object list. In parallel, or before, work on the os-vif changes you need to produce the correct object list, including adding the extra os-vif plugins needed to ensure we are OK for vhostuser. Then its a case of wiring that all up in Nova, which should be fairly simple spec at that point."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-03-20 20:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

Support this effort very much. A few suggestions and question inline but nothing too onerous.

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-19 02:04:17.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This appears abandoned. I know Sean and Radolfo at Intel have some POC code for vif negotiation, but the spec is proposed for Pike and we're a day away from Queens spec freeze, so I'm going to abandon this. It would need to be cleaned up and restored for Queens, but it's pretty late for Queens at this point."}]

[{'created': '2016-10-25 10:33:33.000000000', 'message': 'VIF plugging negotiation between Nova and Neutron

At the moment Neutron unilaterally decides which VIF type to use
and Nova fails to start a VM if that VIF type is not suitable
(because of hypervisor restrictions) or not usable (because, e.g.,
vhostuser connections depend on compatible flavor).

This describes a change to the Nova-Neutron code to allow Nova to
explain what will work and Neutron to make sensible decisions
without compromising backward compatibility.

commit_message:
VIF plugging negotiation between Nova and Neutron

At the moment Neutron unilaterally decides which VIF type to use
and Nova fails to start a VM if that VIF type is not suitable
(because of hypervisor restrictions) or not usable (because, e.g.,
vhostuser connections depend on compatible flavor).

This describes a change to the Nova-Neutron code to allow Nova to
explain what will work and Neutron to make sensible decisions
without compromising backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I7d4b0fc42458258b8894f7e7fce2a7186e66e3b7

[{'created': '2017-10-16 07:50:28.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Define states of lease, reservation and event

This patch defines states of the lease, reservation and event in the
states.py. A member of *State class replaces state literals.

e.g. The 'pending' literal is replaced by the ReservationState.PENDING.

The LeaseState class provides a decorator for the *-lease method of the
ManagerService class. A status of a lease is checked and updated
before/after executing *-lease methods by decorating these methods.
It utilizes the 'status' field of the leases table.

Change-Id: I014aba977e5203bb72e055d08716f84ff76015cc
Related to blueprint state-machine

commit_message:
Add a status module

This patch adds a new status module which defines statuses of a lease,
reservation and event. It also provides basic features for managing
these statuses.

The LeaseStatus class provides a lease_status method which is used as a
decorator for the *-lease method of the ManagerService class.
A status of a lease is checked and updated before/after executing
*-lease methods by decorating these methods. This patch decorates some
*-lease methods with it.

This patch also replaces status literals with members of the *Status
classes, e.g. the 'pending' literal is replaced by
ReservationStatus.PENDING.

Implements: blueprint state-machine
Change-Id: I014aba977e5203bb72e055d08716f84ff76015cc

commit_message:
Check fips bound to host before creating fip ns

Now, useless fip namespace is created on network node for DVR.
We should check if this is an agent with "dvr" mode or there are
fips bound to host before creating fip namespace

Change-Id: I693a5948637ecf2f0a7705b623034c548f678d90
Closes-Bug: #1723828

commit_message:
Retired ceilometerclient

The Ceilometer API has been deprecated for 2 cycles and the code has been
removed from master (Queens). There is no need for this client anymore, which
is not really maintained for a few years now.

Change-Id: Ibf844aa741b28001ef0d2f841f6137cb28259595
Depends-On: I65738a55db82053643f7580eee20b63df52b957f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 10:25:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix exception raise in swift-ring-builder on empty rings

This fixes an issue when the builder file is empty (ie directly after
creation), which is a bit different compared to a ring where all devices
have been deleted before.

Closes-Bug: 1737068
Change-Id: Iafeaae7a58ac7036ab9c8b7595d3d7a5a9d53537
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception raise in swift-ring-builder on empty rings

This fixes an issue when the builder file is empty (ie directly after
creation), which is a bit different compared to a ring where all devices
have been deleted before.

Closes-Bug: 1737068
Change-Id: Iafeaae7a58ac7036ab9c8b7595d3d7a5a9d53537

commit_message:
FlashSystems: permit snapshot/clone volumes larger than source

Permit clone volumes and volumes created from snapshots to
be larger than their source volumes; implemented in response
to failures in the following CI tests:
  * VolumesSnapshotTestJSON.test_volume_from_snapshot
  * VolumesCloneTest.test_create_from_volume

Change-Id: I21511e5c4db62563c61815c1671e8bb44ad3f427
Closes-Bug: #1560655
(cherry picked from commit 927367cd9af6adf260bea4da4dcc5cc94eaa7b13)

commit_message:
Allow necessary write permissions for BIND zone creation

By default on both Red Hat and Ubuntu BIND does not have the
necessary file permissions to create new zones.  Since we need to
be able to do that for Designate to function, we need to tweak the
permissions at deployment time.

Previously this was done in puppet-openstack-integration, but for
TripleO to deploy Designate we need it done in this module as
TripleO doesn't use p-o-i.

Change-Id: I09e8799f0b2a4113833983d67b3c4d40a0355933
bp designate-support

commit_message:
Update the list of ironic jobs in nova's experimental queue

Remove:
* pxe_ipa-full which has never passed and is not in our plans
* resourceclass as all jobs on master and pike use resource classes

Add:
* the multinode job with the correct name
* the boot-from-volume job

Change-Id: I10ee0fc318193d419bfd1d00454fa03d7b307c37

commit_message:
Rename 'tenant' to 'project' in server

The entire OpenStack community is moving from 'tenant' to 'project'.
Zun should follow this effort.

Change-Id: Id434c44e0263711fe09094007ce202d42c2405ab
Closes-Bug: #1741809
