commit_message:
Allow NetworkManager to work (if present)

This patch adds tasks that check to see if NetworkManager is
installed and running. If it is, the tasks allow NetworkManager
to handle the `lxcbr0` interface.

In addition, the `NetworkManager-wait-online.service` will be
enabled to ensure that all services that depend on networking will
wait for network configuration to be completed.

Partial-Bug: 1738467
Change-Id: I415241daccf22f03826062eea18b3b36b2d9e53e
(cherry picked from commit a468089727de4fb2b7eec373a2412cc0028c4a03)

commit_message:
Remove mox from requirements

Mox was listed in test-requirements, but it is not actually
being used anywhere. Since we want to get rid of this package
in OpenStack, removing from requirements so it does not look
like it is being used.

Change-Id: Id28298c0327ac1780f17d9d7245360116814fd67

[{'created': '2018-01-08 06:22:04.000000000', 'message': "Change debian mariadb backup tool to mariabackup

Current debian stretch use mariadb 10.1.26 which integrates
a backup tool call 'MariaDB Backup' [1]. It is based on
Percona XtraBackup and support full backup capability for
MariaDB Server that includes encrypted and compressed data.

This patch also fixs muti-node deployment failed on Debian
aarch64. Percona's repo has no XtraBackup package for Debian
aarch64. In such case we can use MariaDB builtin backup tool
'MariaDB Backup'.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariadb-backup-overview/

Change-Id: I7271d3f93b41d4839670a2c4a358744333411cd7
"}]
commit_message:
Change debian mariadb backup tool to mariabackup

Current debian stretch use mariadb 10.1.26 which integrates
a backup tool call 'MariaDB Backup' [1]. It is based on
Percona XtraBackup and support full backup capability for
MariaDB Server that includes encrypted and compressed data.

This patch also fixs muti-node deployment failed on Debian
aarch64. Percona's repo has no XtraBackup package for Debian
aarch64. In such case we can use MariaDB builtin backup tool
'MariaDB Backup'.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariadb-backup-overview/

Change-Id: I7271d3f93b41d4839670a2c4a358744333411cd7

subject: Raise exception when failing to plug port to network
messages:
[{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-01-09 15:17:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thanks Pierre.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-01-10 18:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you Mark for the quick review! I will investigate a more generic solution.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-10 18:58:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thank you Mark for the quick review! I will investigate a more
 > generic solution.

@vsaienk0, @pas-ha, I'd be interested to hear your thoughts on a general error handling mechanism."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 15:17:55.000000000', 'message': 'Raise exception when failing to plug port to network

On Dell Force10 switches, if an interface is left untagged in another
VLAN, networking-generic-switch will silently fail to plug the port to
the network. Only when Neutron is in debug mode, the following line is
displayed as part of the Netmiko session:

    % Error: <interface> Port is untagged in another Vlan.

With this patch, the Dell Force10 device driver detects the error
returned by the switch command and raises a new exception:
GenericSwitchPlugPortToNetworkError.

While this is not a fatal error since Neutron retries the bind_port
operation 10 times before continuing, it ensures that the problem is
logged at ERROR level, and thus may be better noticed by operators.

Change-Id: Ie8ec1f27d4e1389386158142b467c8feeb9cc696
'}]
commit_message:
Raise exception when failing to plug port to network

On Dell Force10 switches, if an interface is left untagged in another
VLAN, networking-generic-switch will silently fail to plug the port to
the network. Only when Neutron is in debug mode, the following line is
displayed as part of the Netmiko session:

    % Error: <interface> Port is untagged in another Vlan.

With this patch, the Dell Force10 device driver detects the error
returned by the switch command and raises a new exception:
GenericSwitchPlugPortToNetworkError.

While this is not a fatal error since Neutron retries the bind_port
operation 10 times before continuing, it ensures that the problem is
logged at ERROR level, and thus may be better noticed by operators.

Change-Id: Ie8ec1f27d4e1389386158142b467c8feeb9cc696

subject: Fix tox_install.sh script
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 8932, 'name': 'Telles Mota Vidal Nóbrega', 'email': 'tellesnobrega@gmail.com', 'username': 'tellesnobrega'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26001, 'name': 'gongguilan', 'email': 'gongguilan@gohighsec.com', 'username': 'gongguilan'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 13:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-10 13:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Pavlo, the last time that the fie was changed it was done to synchronize it content with the same file used in other projects. Did you fix the other instances too, or do you plan to at least inform the maintainers? I added Andreas as reviewers as he did the sync.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 13:40:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Luigi, I just stumbled on it when trying to run unit tests for stable/ocata branch, which currently fail with multiple errors on failing to import:

  from openstack_dashboard.test.test_data import heat_data

since the master of horizon is installed (despite having BRANCH_NAME=stable/ocata in the tox.ini) and heat dashboard was recently removed from horizon to a separate project.

Thus I am making this patch first and then proposing cherry-picks to stable branches.

All the other projects seem a bit different each, so I can't say for all of them, just that the sahara-dashboard unit tests on stable/ocata (and may be pike) are broken currently.

Thanks for adding Andreas, was going to do the same."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 13:41:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

alternatively though I could just change the hardcoded 'master' to 'stable/ocata' in ocata branch of tox_install.sh,

but that would just add yet another place to remember to change when cutting stable branches, so fixing it proper seems better."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 13:47:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

stable/pike branch is also affected, what's more it has BRANCH_NAME=master in tox.ini o_O

will make a cherry-pick too."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 14:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck

somehow missed zuul queue'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-10 17:35:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-10 17:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-01-10 18:41:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Fix tox_install.sh script

currently it actually hardcodes the horizon branch to install as
'master' with no way of overriding it via env var as it was intended.

Change-Id: Ia18353387b00e2807d69dcbeca08457bd662d26e

commit_message:
Amend future of classic drivers with automated migration

It was requested by operators on the Forum that we provide at least
some migration between classic drivers and hardware types.

This change proposes using the "online_data_migration" command
to migrate existing nodes.

Change-Id: I647b4011bbbfd92cd2e4007792bd03d7ba88bc39

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 19:54:42.000000000', 'message': 'show the relative age of old tags

When we list the version of each of the other branches include the
relative date info for when the tag was applied. This can be useful
for noticing that a project is not tagging libraries very often and
needs to be encouraged to tag more.

Change-Id: I3b1e195aca23eb32514ef32cccab8b04636aae5d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
show the relative age of old tags

When we list the version of each of the other branches include the
relative date info for when the tag was applied. This can be useful
for noticing that a project is not tagging libraries very often and
needs to be encouraged to tag more.

Change-Id: I3b1e195aca23eb32514ef32cccab8b04636aae5d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-10 07:43:39.000000000', 'message': 'Storwize: add hyperswap volume support

This patch add hyperswap volume spport for Storwize/SVC driver.

New properties are added in volume type configuration:
drivers:peer_topology set to "hyperswap" will specify a hyperswap volume
drivers:peer_pool specify the pool hyperswap remote copy volume is stored
drivers:host_site specify the site of the host.
hyperswap_group_enabled="<is> True" will setup a hyperswap volume group.

DocImpact
Implements: bluprint svc-hyperswap-support

Change-Id: I989d22d9580c1f44546f371af1fffded14ddcbe3

commit_message:
Storwize: add hyperswap volume support

This patch adds hyperswap volume support for Storwize/SVC driver.

New properties are added in volume type configuration:
drivers:volume_topology sets to "hyperswap" would specify a
hyperswap volume.
drivers:peer_pool specifies the pool that hyperswap remote copy
volume is stored.
drivers:host_site specifies the site name of the host.

New property is added in group type configuration:
hyperswap_group_enabled="<is> True" would setup a hyperswap group.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint svc-hyperswap-support

Change-Id: I989d22d9580c1f44546f371af1fffded14ddcbe3

commit_message:
Add has_any_traits() to provider tree

Adds a new method, has_any_traits(), to the compute provider tree class.
This method is analagous to the has_inventory() method, and checks
whether a resource provider in the tree has any traits set.

blueprint ironic-driver-traits

Change-Id: Ica2f337b39f4f993ebca4f21adbe99fedcd5747b

commit_message:
Add a StorageNFS network for use by Manila/Ganesha

This change adds a StorageNFS network to the list of networks in
network_data.yaml. This will be eventually required by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471245 which will implement
Ganesha. This network will be disabled by default, and will be
enabled as part of the Isolated Networking configuration when
Ganesha is in use.

Depends-On: Ic671f0c5027991280a4f28e9119d1889e929bd5a
Change-Id: I2ca4a85442c4f4f8ae279bbe17c1c12813558cab

commit_message:
Add option to run job automatically in reproducing

When reproducing a job add option to run it automatically when
setup is finished.
If not running automatically, print help instructions, which are
safe to copy-paste and run in terminal.

Change-Id: Ieea9013488a8c3c0dd4362e3774f045f7a04b246

commit_message:
Avoid retrieving IP from a missing bridge

On hosts that do not have any containers (ie. computes) network bridges
are not needed and may introduce some unwanted overhead. This
configuration was possible until Mitaka, but broke with the
dynamic-address-fact.yml tasks in Newton.

This change checks if the bridge actually exists and otherwise uses the
IP configured in the inventory instead.

Change-Id: I23668429a19f00f520ac18c76254e83708778d5a
(cherry picked from commit ea32c3da767d156dc851abd9d2b5121375b760e8)

commit_message:
Added error msg when gets redirect to login page

This checkin includes the followings:

1.Added an error toast message when user gets
unauthorized 401 or 404 error during operation.

2.When the modal dialog shows up, it also adds an error
message at the top of the dialog.

3.Also added some unit tests to let the coverage passes
the threshold.

Change-Id: I5e0962937932a21565d374561f09f98013063a4f
Closes-bug: #1555415

It's very cool , and will gave a great isolation and break the coupling between the apps . and it's very help-full!  
some small notes : 
1. I think this spec with apps isolation - not with abstraction above the data-patch - so i this apps-isolation is better name for this specs 
2. about the registers - i think the "shared_variables" have a global meaning like src-app and so on - so I think that it's will be better if they will declared globally and not per app . 
about the "private_variables" - why they need to be declared at all. it's not relevant to other applications.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2017-12-19 13:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Rename CloudConfig to CloudRegion

The name CloudConfig has always sucked. While working on the next patch,
it occurred to me that what a CloudConfig represents is the config for a
given region of a cloud. We even reference "Cloud Region" as a unit of
work when giving conference talks.

Take the opportunity while we're doing this sdk/occ merge to rename it.
Obviously we can provide naming compat shim in OCC itself.

Leave in *some* naming compat shims to get us past the 0.10 release so
that OSC continues to have the happies.

Change-Id: Ia0bbc20eb28a3a36e69adba3a4b45323e4aa284e

BGPVPNAssociation OVO object was initially created because
we hadn't identified that bulk_pull was available.  Some amount
of code can go away by removing this class and using bulk_pull
instead.

This change is the first step: start using bulk_pull.

Change-Id: I9ed25ab7f7413b7eb5d9d1a8074a2fb3bc779f1b

commit_message:
BGPVPN OVO: use bulk_pull and remove BGPVPNAssociations

BGPVPNAssociation OVO object was initially created because
we hadn't identified that bulk_pull was available.  Some amount
of code can go away by removing this class and using bulk_pull
instead.

This change is the first step: start using bulk_pull.

Change-Id: I9ed25ab7f7413b7eb5d9d1a8074a2fb3bc779f1b

commit_message:
Add networking-generic-switch-tempest-plugin repo

n-g-s was recently added to baremetal projects [0]
We would like to move tempest code to tempest-plugin.
This patch creates repo and add initial jobs for
n-g-s-tempest-plugin.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521894/

Change-Id: I53c1ca3c30b6fe77f42657b4756dada22115ea9c

commit_message:
Code cleanup

* Most of v2/fakes.py's content replaced by constants and
  a single utility function.
* Corrected pool columns provisioning_status field name
* Renamed TestL7Policy class name to TestL7Rule in test_l7rule.py
* Removed calls for dict.keys() is tests/fakes.py
* Renamed 'mem' class member to '_mem' for consistency

Change-Id: Icf978dfdc3c82e16d1ca94fd9a1cce0053527db0

commit_message:
retrive service only by id

In an env of multi controller nodes, there would be duplicate services
for watcher, and the name is not unique, so it will raise exception
when calling the Watcher service APIs by name.

commit_message:
always decode branch description

When the git describe command fails, we still need to decode the
output text so we don't print it as raw bytes.

Change-Id: I0e264218643b3f4dfce54169b48b5ae60ef057af
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-09 21:03:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13940, 'date': '2018-01-10 12:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 21:03:49.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mox from requirements

Mox and mox3 were listed in test-requirements, but neither is
actually used anywhere. Since we are trying to remove the use
of mox from OpenStack, this clears them from the requirements
so it does not look like they are being used.

Change-Id: I954e97202ed62e17d31993a57c3891a1f6903799
'}]
commit_message:
Remove mox from requirements

Mox and mox3 were listed in test-requirements, but neither is
actually used anywhere. Since we are trying to remove the use
of mox from OpenStack, this clears them from the requirements
so it does not look like they are being used.

Change-Id: I954e97202ed62e17d31993a57c3891a1f6903799

commit_message:
scenario002: disable ironic until next RDO promotion

The tempest plugin was moved, it breaks Ironic...
We need to get RDO promotion first, so we can get new package and update
puppet-tempest: https://review.openstack.org/532210

Change-Id: I0e020b01662dfac4fe5fabde987ca54bd6f1e418

subject: Bump keystonemiddleware version due to cache bug
messages: [{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-10 03:58:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-10 04:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nhttps://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/commit/35fa0e1da1b96a40aa2aa6dd2be378e4155a22ba'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-10 05:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 03:58:34.000000000', 'message': 'Bump keystonemiddleware version due to cache bug

4.19.0 introduced use of oslo.cache which made memcache
a requirement, this broke some things, version 4.20.0
makes that lazy loaded to stop unexpected import
requirements.

Change-Id: I7bdf02307be1ce559b92da1a43b8f02c122193ce
'}]
commit_message:
Bump keystonemiddleware version due to cache bug

4.19.0 introduced use of oslo.cache which made memcache
a requirement, this broke some things, version 4.20.0
makes that lazy loaded to stop unexpected import
requirements.

Change-Id: I7bdf02307be1ce559b92da1a43b8f02c122193ce

commit_message:
Fix path for iscsi config file

We changed the bind mount to be /etc/iscsi in
I838427ccae06cfe1be72939c4bcc2978f7dc36a8, we need to copy the files to
/etc/iscsi so that they do not end up at '/' in the container.

Change-Id: Id5c1f16d08ffd36a35a6669d64460a7b2240d401
Closes-Bug: #1741850

commit_message:
Update roles listing

* Mistral action now returns whole role objects, not just a list
  of names. This change reflects it
* Roles are normalized
* Role title is computed rather than stored in app state
* Roles are stored by name as it is official unique identificator

Depends-On: Ib1755bcf5c1361a3e5616014bf063f69e49687c6
Implements: blueprint roles-crud-ui
Change-Id: I7db8872bf26a48b8c34e57e5ab6a5ed85e8a220b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 12:05:58.000000000', 'message': 'Rework mariadb recovery tasks

In recover_cluster.yaml playbook the task to find the highest seqno/Global Transaction ID is no longer relying only on grastate.dat
Instead it now follows the recommendations from galera cluster website http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/restartingcluster.html

Change-Id: I0d19a97c76b364e364400bc631aa6a9dc1a7e35f
Closes-Bug: 1682153
'}]
commit_message:
Rework mariadb recovery tasks

In recover_cluster.yaml playbook the task to find the highest seqno/Global Transaction ID is no longer relying only on grastate.dat
Instead it now follows the recommendations from galera cluster website http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/restartingcluster.html

Change-Id: I0d19a97c76b364e364400bc631aa6a9dc1a7e35f
Closes-Bug: 1682153

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 16:14:06.000000000', 'message': "Enable periodic discovery of nova hosts in cells

This is required for nova to see new ironic nodes. Currently, we run
'nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts' in tripleo-common, but it only
affects nodes enrolled via our workflows. Nodes enrolled via auto-discovery
are not affected by it, and it may be impossible to deploy on them.
The same applies to node enrolled via ironic CLI directly.

The periodic task is already enabled by default for ironic in the overcloud
with a period of 15 seconds. This patch enables the same in the undercloud.

After this change lands, calling nova-manage from mistral won't be
required any more.

Change-Id: I1b9b5049cda7e6484b691a8032d68ac89249f047
Closes-Bug: #1742179
"}]
commit_message:
Enable periodic discovery of nova hosts in cells

This is required for nova to see new ironic nodes. Currently, we run
'nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts' in tripleo-common, but it only
affects nodes enrolled via our workflows. Nodes enrolled via auto-discovery
are not affected by it, and it may be impossible to deploy on them.
The same applies to node enrolled via ironic CLI directly.

The periodic task is already enabled by default for ironic in the overcloud
with a period of 15 seconds. This patch enables the same in the undercloud.

After this change lands, calling nova-manage from mistral won't be
required any more.

Change-Id: I1b9b5049cda7e6484b691a8032d68ac89249f047
Closes-Bug: #1742179

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 01:02:18.000000000', 'message': 'Remove repo priority from ocata to pike testing.

This makes some package to not be updated like puppet-pacemaker.  This
one is more recent in the pike-testing repo than in delorean:

  - https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-pike/6f/18/6f18d036d2ff6c5831b5e114a252a5f4c67702ea_09a4208c/ (delorean)
  - https://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-pike/

Removing the priorities should enable the most recent package to be
installed no matter what.

Change-Id: I97abd848cced70627bd8296d13ab5e8515eeba13
'}]
commit_message:
Remove repo priority from ocata to pike testing.

This makes some package to not be updated like puppet-pacemaker.  This
one is more recent in the pike-testing repo than in delorean:

  - https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-pike/6f/18/6f18d036d2ff6c5831b5e114a252a5f4c67702ea_09a4208c/ (delorean)
  - https://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-pike/

Removing the priorities should enable the most recent package to be
installed no matter what.

Change-Id: I97abd848cced70627bd8296d13ab5e8515eeba13

commit_message:
upgrade: Ensure ceph-mgr is bootstrapped

When upgrading to Luminous, ensure that the ceph-mgr daemons
are bootstrapped *once* all ceph-mons have been upgraded.

This ensures that the call to create the required keyring
supports the new profile for the mgr daemon.

Change-Id: Iff04c493a642cc5475eb31653064c2bab1210539
Closes-Bug: 1742408

commit_message:
Add receipes for mariadb cluster deployment

After removal of the percona cluster receipes, add support for deploying
a galera-based mariadb cluster instead.

Change-Id: I7e4d0fc804be242302d2e7b7202159d4b7ba8c97
(cherry picked from commit 7df72be05fc874e372400adc5e3c008e6edf6634)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

This  implementation has a potential race condition in  magnum/drivers/common/templates/swarm/fragments/swarm-launch-prometheus-grafana.sh where two may try to start up simultaneously. I would like to see better handling of that case, or supply rationale explaining why it's not important. It looks to me like simultaneous access is not handled, and it treats the existence of a running container as the concurrency control. That may not work if the container start takes a non-zero duration of time."}, {'account_id': 20031, 'date': '2016-12-08 14:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24460, 'date': '2016-12-08 14:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24460, 'date': '2016-12-08 15:08:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

> This  implementation has a potential race condition in 
 > magnum/drivers/common/templates/swarm/fragments/swarm-launch-prometheus-grafana.sh
 > where two may try to start up simultaneously. I would like to see
 > better handling of that case, or supply rationale explaining why
 > it's not important. It looks to me like simultaneous access is not
 > handled, and it treats the existence of a running container as the
 > concurrency control. That may not work if the container start takes
 > a non-zero duration of time.

This is true, and I've experienced those racing conditions, but only with the fedora and grafana containers. The Prometheus containers might be requested in simultaneous. Due to their name attribute I expect one to simply fail and due to the following piece of code, exit the script, not even trying to deploy the remaining fedora and grafana containers. 
This is not robust, agreed. But Docker v1.12 already has services and this will simplify things a lot."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-08 16:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-06 16:03:48.000000000', 'message': 'container monitoring in Swarm with Docker v1.10

a few changes on the HEAT templates plus some new
fragments now allow, by default, to have monitoring
enabled in Swarm clusters running with Docker v1.10.

The templates will install a cadvisor and node-exporter
container on each node and master. As a ExecStartPost,
the cadvisor service on the nodes will launch a script
to deploy (if absent) a Prometheus container and a
Grafana container with affinity to Prometheus.
An auxiliary container will be launched to do the
node discovery in the cluster and update the
Prometheus configuration (the cluster master nodes
are not yet included in Prometheus config - TBD).

In the end, a Grafana UI will be available with
the default login admin:admin. The user has to
inject the Prometheus datasource running in the
same node in port 9090.

The respective API modifications, fine tuning, adding
TLS to monitoring containers and adding compliance
with Docker v1.12 are improvements in progress, to
be added in future reviews

Change-Id: I138a70d3dedad90e8065d92e1c6dbc8cb9b56d81
'}, {'created': '2016-12-08 10:18:23.000000000', 'message': 'container monitoring in Swarm with Docker v1.10

Grafana container with affinity to Prometheus.
An auxiliary container will be launched to do the
node discovery in the cluster and update the
Prometheus configuration (the cluster master nodes
are not yet included in Prometheus config - TBD).

In the end, a Grafana UI will be available with
the default login admin:admin. The user has to
inject the Prometheus datasource running in the
same node in port 9090.

The respective API modifications, fine tuning, adding
TLS to monitoring containers and adding compliance
with Docker v1.12 are improvements in progress, to
be added in future reviews

Partially-Implements: blueprint container-monitoring
Change-Id: I138a70d3dedad90e8065d92e1c6dbc8cb9b56d81

commit_message:
[swarm] Monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana

A few changes on the HEAT templates plus some new fragments now
allow, by default, to have monitoring enabled in Swarm clusters
running with Docker v1.10.

The templates will install a cadvisor and node-exporter container on
each node and master. As an ExecStartPost, the cadvisor service on the
nodes will launch a script to deploy (if absent) a Prometheus
container and a Grafana container with affinity to Prometheus.  An
auxiliary container will be launched to do the node discovery in the
cluster and update the Prometheus configuration (the cluster master
nodes are not yet included in Prometheus config - TBD).

In the end, a Grafana UI will be available with the default login
admin:admin. The user has to inject the Prometheus datasource running
in the same node in port 9090.

The respective API modifications, fine tuning, adding TLS to
monitoring containers and adding compliance with Docker v1.12 are
improvements in progress, to be added in future reviews.

Partially-Implements: blueprint container-monitoring
Change-Id: I138a70d3dedad90e8065d92e1c6dbc8cb9b56d81

commit_message:
fix DB migration for MySQL

current version of migration API doesn't allow to
pass several commands to one execute

Change-Id: I0a74c87c4c782a7a26aa0e67fada994cb3e31434

This has failed previously:

http://logs.openstack.org/89/527289/1/check/ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-multinode/406d4ab/logs/screen-n-cond-cell1.txt.gz?level=TRACE

It was hitting reschedules, but I haven't dug into that failure to trace the request ID to see if we were actually using alternate hosts properly.

I did talk with Ed a bit yesterday about the alternates stuff and I think we still might have a gap with Ironic because of the host:node cardinality.

We're only trying alternate hosts, and we're not scoping that to nodes, so if we have:

hostA:node1
hostA:node2
hostB:node1

If hostA:node1 fails, we'll only try hostB:node1 because we considered hostA a failure, even though hostA:node2 might work."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-19 01:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-12 03:00:30.000000000', 'message': "Run in superconductor cellsv2 mode for non-grenade jobs

Added in change I2bbdac5cd431e72517cb1c72bb925660ec8e868b,
ironic needed to run the multi-node jobs in singleconductor
mode because they rely on reschedules working in nova, which
doesn't work in superconductor mode where the top-level conductor
and scheduler are on a different message queue from the compute
service and cell conductor.

With the alternate hosts series in nova in Queens, we should have
the reschedule problem fixed such that when originally scheduling,
we not only get a target host but also a list of alternates for
retries within the cell. This allows us to run ironic multi-node
CI jobs (and all ironic non-upgrade related jobs for that matter)
in the default superconductor mode which is the recommended way
to run nova with cellsv2.

Depends-On: Iae904afb6cb4fcea8bb27741d774ffbe986a5fb4
Change-Id: I755243abed054e6b6556a9a9498e565042293262

commit_message:
Run in superconductor cellsv2 mode for non-grenade jobs

Added in change I2bbdac5cd431e72517cb1c72bb925660ec8e868b,
ironic needed to run the multi-node jobs in singleconductor
mode because they rely on reschedules working in nova, which
doesn't work in superconductor mode where the top-level conductor
and scheduler are on a different message queue from the compute
service and cell conductor.

With the alternate hosts series in nova in Queens, we should have
the reschedule problem fixed such that when originally scheduling,
we not only get a target host but also a list of alternates for
retries within the cell. This allows us to run ironic multi-node
CI jobs (and all ironic non-upgrade related jobs for that matter)
in the default superconductor mode which is the recommended way
to run nova with cellsv2.

Depends-On: Iae904afb6cb4fcea8bb27741d774ffbe986a5fb4
Depends-On: Ie599968d9e7537e551fe6d9deb63a91b256b1e11
Change-Id: I755243abed054e6b6556a9a9498e565042293262

commit_message:
Convert undercloud deploy to use TripleoInventory class

This shares the same code used for the tripleo-ansible-inventory
script, the class now lives in tripleo-common.

This allows us to avoid things breaking when tht or the generated
inventory changes, and reuse the exact same code used for the
config download workflow for overcloud deployments.

Change-Id: I474ceaf7f816e3e9a31051159635bdd49050b06c

The upgrade job fails during the os_previous_keystone role, which
has a few flush_handlers directives, and one seem to trigger

which isn't defined, and cause an issue, as listed in the bug.

commit_message:
Fix undefined handler Manage LB

The upgrade job fails during the os_previous_keystone role, which
has a few flush_handlers directives, and one seem to trigger
"Manage LB" (I haven't found the notify queue leading to it yet),
which isn't defined, and cause an issue, as listed in the bug.

This is a temporary workaround until we figure out what's the
root cause of the issue.

Change-Id: I9a22698668ed974857c2f63d1e505fc83392ec03
Related-Bug: #1741471

commit_message:
py3: Deal with comparison with str and None

Under Python 3, its not possible to compare a float with an object
of type str or NoneType; ensure that these conditions are handled
in the conditional which waits for the previous unit in the cluster
to complete upgrade before the current unit commences.

This change also includes a minor change to the way time span
assessed in unit tests for this function.

Change-Id: I34e3be4c55976d562497257626a339c72efabbad
Closes-Bug: 1742079

commit_message:
multiple or conflict actionplan when multiple decision-engines

Once a desion-engine change the audit from PENDING to ONGOING,
the other desion-engines will not execute the audit, so there
won't be multiple or conflict actionplan.
Closes-Bug: #1737674

Change-Id: Ib53158531f666b6424e105520ac2266fae0053f7

commit_message:
Reload SSH connection before running container image prepare

openstack overcloud container image prepare might fail with
'Permission denied' caused by the issue described in bug 1699477.
This change reloads the SSH connection so the new group setting gets
loaded.

Change-Id: I6801053f54094585d573702fbfc3fb9403f65767

Instead of relying on the dashboard availability
we check the ceph-mgr map

Signed-off-by: Alexandre Marangone <amarango@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-01 03:00:39.000000000', 'message': 'Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).

>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#4>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#5>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I07089a19cb81597f1d0022cc51ebfb8f4b788614
Closes-Bug: #1339855
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).

>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#4>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#5>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I07089a19cb81597f1d0022cc51ebfb8f4b788614
Closes-Bug: #1339855

commit_message:
test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True.

Change-Id: Ifa88b39218c787a9b146133c55f612e2d13b0737
Closes-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: I463961bd73da7fa5f948eee5f6f8593201290637
Closes-Bug: #1517839

`docker daemon` is not supported on Linux. Please run `dockerd` directly

Docker version 1.13.1, build b5e3294/1.13.1
09:08 (s) hrw@puchatek:~$ docker daemon

exec: "dockerd": executable file not found in $PATH'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2017-11-24 13:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> This is the correct option for Docker version 1.13.0 and above, so
 > relastically, thats what you should be keying off of, the version
 > of docker installed.

Thanks for the comments. 
In Debian 9, only docker-ce can be installed, and the docker daemon's name is "dockerd" instead of "docker daemon".'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-24 17:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > This is the correct option for Docker version 1.13.0 and above,
 > so
 > > relastically, thats what you should be keying off of, the version
 > > of docker installed.
 > 
 > Thanks for the comments.
 > In Debian 9, only docker-ce can be installed, and the docker
 > daemon's name is "dockerd" instead of "docker daemon".

Anything above docker 1.13.0 should be using dockerd. "docker-ce" is above docker 1.13.0, despite the silly name changes.

My point is, do not try to key off of the distro, key off of the version of docker installed on the system.'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2017-12-11 10:27:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2017-12-11 10:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:46:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2017-12-11 16:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24574, 'date': '2017-12-13 01:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Change the docker daemon name in Debian 9 on Arm

Enable docker-ce on AArch64 platform in Debian.
Set the docker daemon name according to the existing of "dockerd" binary.

Closes-Bug: #1734255

Co-authored-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>

Change-Id: Ie0b3bac72b408dccf3fb99912b4fe2d4788705e5
Signed-off-by: Tone.Zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 03:35:00.000000000', 'message': 'Synology: Rename iSCSI target config options

Due to the NVMET target driver being implemented, the five config
options (iscsi_ip_address, iscsi_port, iscsi_helper, iscsi_target_prefix,
iscsi_protocol) have been renamed (to target_ip_address, target_port,
target_helper, target_prefix, and target_protocol).

Raise exception when the target_ip_address (instead of iscsi_ip_address)
config key is not found.

Change-Id: I1de3e1a6d7e5e86027dcf916a7b68338dda5b0b1
Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/528515
'}]
commit_message:
Synology: Rename iSCSI target config options

Due to the NVMET target driver being implemented, the five config
options (iscsi_ip_address, iscsi_port, iscsi_helper, iscsi_target_prefix,
iscsi_protocol) have been renamed (to target_ip_address, target_port,
target_helper, target_prefix, and target_protocol).

Raise exception when the target_ip_address (instead of iscsi_ip_address)
config key is not found.

Change-Id: I1de3e1a6d7e5e86027dcf916a7b68338dda5b0b1
Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/528515

commit_message:
bug fix remove volume migration type 'cold'

Migration action 'cold' is not intuitive for the developers and users,
so this patch replaces it with ‘migrate’ and 'retype'.

Change-Id: I58acac741499f47e79630a6031d44088681e038a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 22:48:56.000000000', 'message': "Install ovsdbapp master in neutron + ovsdbapp periodic job

This py35 job against neutron intends on installing ovsdbapp from
master/source but fails beacuse it was trying to install neutron from
source via its requirements.ts but neutron doesn't depend on itself.
We can fix this by explicitly setting the project to be installed from
master to ovsdbapp.

Change-Id: I01c1659c2ab642919d9104ce04c9b3a882b1fa28
"}]
commit_message:
Install ovsdbapp master in neutron + ovsdbapp periodic job

This py35 job against neutron intends on installing ovsdbapp from
master/source but fails beacuse it was trying to install neutron from
source via its requirements.ts but neutron doesn't depend on itself.
We can fix this by explicitly setting the project to be installed from
master to ovsdbapp.

Change-Id: I01c1659c2ab642919d9104ce04c9b3a882b1fa28

commit_message:
Pause builds for dib 2.10 release

It looks like pip install with pip-and-virtualenv element is broken
for python2 with dib 2.10 release.  This probably only affects
Debuntu, but pause everything while we sort it out.

Change-Id: I3baea614480bc07d44c0c881129122eaf0fc8cd0

commit_message:
Refactor class magnum::clients

To make a better support of OpenStack clients' configuration in Magnum,
this patch splits the original magnum::clients into services
related classes and make it compatible with the old version.

Change-Id: I2eb25717fd07833264f1e3b9919b59f917312427

commit_message:
Kubernetes on senlin

Done:
- Add ability to do actions on cluster creation/deletion.
- Add more interfaces with openstacksdk
- Add kubernetes master profile, use kubeadm to setup one master node.
- Add kubernetes node profile, auto retrieve kubernetes data from master cluster.

TODO:
See TODO.md

Change-Id: Ia6a3f562cc776e1df7367a3278aa136db974ff7f

[{'created': '2018-01-09 09:32:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104

Change-Id: I9229d88257dd388ededd666bc0c584fd92a961de
Related-Bug: #1732630
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104

Change-Id: I9229d88257dd388ededd666bc0c584fd92a961de
Related-Bug: #1732630

commit_message:
Fix masked variable name

The loop variable service_type masks the parameter service_type. It's
not a problem in this patch, but becomes a redefinition in the next
patch. It's pulled out here to not mix concerns.

Change-Id: I489d7ecad3f38b15eaa71449461cdd83782bac7a

subject: [Qos] ingress bandwidth limit by ovs is not accurate

I want to test it once again locally to be sure it's working as expected"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-09 21:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

I tested it once again on my local devstack with ovs 2.8.0

Test conditions:
1. I created qos bandwidth limit rule with: --direction ingress --max-kbps 1000 --max-burst-kbps 10 (it was done like that intentionally)

My test was done like:
1. Spawn VM connected to private network,
2. Start iperf3 -s on this VM
3. Start iperf3 -c in "qrouter" namespace on host - from this namespace I had direct connection to VM through qrXXX interface

Results for test with and without this patch was the same, please check it on http://paste.openstack.org/show/628502/

Conclusion: IMO this patch don't change anything.
We can merge it be perfectly consistent with what is described in OVS faq but it will not change anything in how this limits works.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2017-12-10 00:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

@slawek
1.I test it with ovs 2.7. Maybe you test it with ovs 2.7 too.
  I will update to ovs 2.8 to test it again.
2. I think you maybe test it with 10M, 100M and 150M bindlimit, not just 1M bindlimt. 
in http://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/faq/qos/, recommended commands:
$ ovs-vsctl -- \
  add-br br0 -- \
  add-port br0 eth0 -- \
  add-port br0 vif1.0 -- set interface vif1.0 ofport_request=5 -- \
  add-port br0 vif2.0 -- set interface vif2.0 ofport_request=6 -- \
  set port eth0 qos=@newqos -- \
  --id=@newqos create qos type=linux-htb \
      other-config:max-rate=1000000000 \
      queues:123=@vif10queue \
      queues:234=@vif20queue -- \
  --id=@vif10queue create queue other-config:max-rate=10000000 -- \
  --id=@vif20queue create queue other-config:max-rate=20000000
 
Maybe you should look at the ovs handbook.
other_config : max-rate: optional string, containing an integer
Maximum rate shared by all queued traffic, in bit/s. Optional. If not specified, for physical interfaces,
the default is the link rate. For other interfaces or if the link rate cannot be determined, the
default is currently 100 Mbps.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-10 09:40:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I did same tests again today but I configured 200Mbps as limit value and I checked it also on ovs 2.5.2 - results are similar.
Without Your patch: http://paste.openstack.org/show/628520/
With Your patch: http://paste.openstack.org/show/628519/

I tested it also without any QoS applied to port and I had results at about 3 Gbits/s

But AFAIU ovs documentation it can sometimes limit to not proper value (max. 100Mbps) because this value is set as default global max-rate value for all queues in qos if max-rate is not given and can't be determined from link. Maybe You had such case during Your testing?"}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2017-12-11 08:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Anyway, my test here is not accurate. Compute node in my openstack environment is not real physical sever, but EXSI host.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2017-12-12 11:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

@Slawek Kaplonski 
It is my testing result
 http://paste.openstack.org/show/628703/'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2017-12-12 12:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

1. set 120Mkbps ingress direction bindlimit
openstack network qos rule set --max-kbps 120000 --max-burst-kbits 12000 --ingress bw-limiter fdd5bf18-7c5d-48cd-9b99-0c2668f1ba47

2. testing result 
Without my patch: http://paste.openstack.org/show/628703/
With my patch: http://paste.openstack.org/show/628715/

my patch can fix the inaccurate problem.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-12 12:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(3 comments)

> 1. set 120Mkbps ingress direction bindlimit
 > openstack network qos rule set --max-kbps 120000 --max-burst-kbits
 > 12000 --ingress bw-limiter fdd5bf18-7c5d-48cd-9b99-0c2668f1ba47
 > 
 > 2. testing result
 > Without my patch: http://paste.openstack.org/show/628703/
 > With my patch: http://paste.openstack.org/show/628715/
 > 
 > my patch can fix the inaccurate problem.

Thx for Your tests. After reading it and after short talk on IRC, it looks that we tested on different configs. I had config with hybrid plug so QoS was applied on "qvoXXX" interface which is veth and it's link_speed was set to 10000000000 bps and You tested without hybrid plug so QoS was applied on "tapXXX" which has lower link_speed and that link_speed was limiting bandwidth globally for all queues attached to qos.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2017-12-13 01:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2017-12-13 04:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

"}, {'created': '2017-12-13 01:42:09.000000000', 'message': '[Qos] ingress bandwidth limit by ovs is not accurate

According to Open vSwitch FAQ [1], max-rate value which is set for
all queues in qos is set as link speed in case when it is not specified.
This can lead to inaccurate ingress bandwidth limits in case when QoS is
applied e.g. directly on tapXXX port (which is "tun" interface type) and
configured bandwidth limit is higher than interface's link_speed.
This patch set max-rate parameter in qos's other_config table to not use
default value determined by Open vSwitch and to make rate limits more
accurate.

The modification is covered by functional tests in
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/
functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py.

[1] http://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/faq/qos/

Change-Id: Id937216a724fbf776298efd11f74ac71056cfe06
Closes-Bug: #1730605
'}]
commit_message:
[Qos] ingress bandwidth limit by ovs is not accurate

According to Open vSwitch FAQ [1], max-rate value which is set for
all queues in qos is set as link speed in case when it is not specified.
This can lead to inaccurate ingress bandwidth limits in case when QoS is
applied e.g. directly on tapXXX port (which is "tun" interface type) and
configured bandwidth limit is higher than interface's link_speed.
This patch set max-rate parameter in qos's other_config table to not use
default value determined by Open vSwitch and to make rate limits more
accurate.

The modification is covered by functional tests in
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/
functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py.

[1] http://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/faq/qos/

Change-Id: Id937216a724fbf776298efd11f74ac71056cfe06
Closes-Bug: #1730605

commit_message:
Add ansible-lint to linters jobs

Switch basepython to python3 since zuulv3 requires it. Also clone both
zuul and zuul-jobs for required ansible dependencies.

Change-Id: Id1a44f626ad022349215598562cf804a48daff1c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 16:13:55.000000000', 'message': "nova: release newton 14.1.0

This is a minor version bump because there is a database
schema migration in here related to a bug fix. It is optional
to actually run the schema migration, but the minor version
bump is used to signal it's more than just an ordinary
patch release.

Change-Id: I0fd6f698b6bb240b8700a28abcd9e68d23f204ee
"}, {'created': '2017-12-20 18:09:31.000000000', 'message': "nova: release newton 14.1.0

This is a minor version bump because there is a database
schema migration in here related to a bug fix. It is optional
to actually run the schema migration, but the minor version

commit_message:
nova: release newton 14.1.0

This is a minor version bump because there is a database
schema migration in here related to a bug fix. It is optional
to actually run the schema migration, but the minor version
bump is used to signal it's more than just an ordinary
patch release.

Depends-On: I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab

Change-Id: I0fd6f698b6bb240b8700a28abcd9e68d23f204ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 23:38:25.000000000', 'message': 'Index zuul executor

It would be useful to know what zuul executor ran a job so that we can
track potential executor specific issues back to that executor via
logstash. Add the zuul executors hostname to the log processing payload
which will result in us storing it in elasticsearch.

Change-Id: Ifbd7c7f91a006bd63e3df6053297ccc36bb3240b
'}]
commit_message:
Index zuul executor

It would be useful to know what zuul executor ran a job so that we can
track potential executor specific issues back to that executor via
logstash. Add the zuul executors hostname to the log processing payload
which will result in us storing it in elasticsearch.

Change-Id: Ifbd7c7f91a006bd63e3df6053297ccc36bb3240b

update constraint for oslo.serialization to new release 2.20.2

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 15:39:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix an error in _get_host_states when deleting a compute node

_get_host_states returns a generator which closes over seen_nodes, which
is local, and self.host_state_map, which is global. It also modifies
self.host_state_map, and will remove entries whose compute nodes are no
longer present.

If a compute node is deleted while a filter is still evaluating the
generator returned by _get_host_states, the entry in self.host_state_map
will be deleted if _get_host_states is called again. This will cause a
KeyError when the first generator comes to evaluate the entry for the
deleted compute node.

We fix this by modifying the returned generator expression to check
that a host_state_map entry still exists before returning it. An
existing unit test is modified to exhibit the bug.

Change-Id: Ibb7c43a0abc433f93fc3de71146263e6d5923666
Closes-Bug: #1739323
(cherry picked from commit d72b33b986525a9b2c7aa08b609ae386de1d0e89)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix an error in _get_host_states when deleting a compute node

_get_host_states returns a generator which closes over seen_nodes, which
is local, and self.host_state_map, which is global. It also modifies
self.host_state_map, and will remove entries whose compute nodes are no
longer present.

If a compute node is deleted while a filter is still evaluating the
generator returned by _get_host_states, the entry in self.host_state_map
will be deleted if _get_host_states is called again. This will cause a
KeyError when the first generator comes to evaluate the entry for the
deleted compute node.

We fix this by modifying the returned generator expression to check
that a host_state_map entry still exists before returning it. An
existing unit test is modified to exhibit the bug.

Change-Id: Ibb7c43a0abc433f93fc3de71146263e6d5923666
Closes-Bug: #1739323
(cherry picked from commit d72b33b986525a9b2c7aa08b609ae386de1d0e89)

commit_message:
Remove mox3 from requirements

Mox3 was listed in test-requirements, but it is not actually
being used. Since we are trying to get rid of this package
in OpenStack, removing from requirements so it does not look
like it is being used.

Change-Id: Ie04da5c0689cf8cb42593b0854b1a8fb26933465

commit_message:
Add missing unit tests for FilterScheduler._get_all_host_states

This addresses a review comment from change
I8666e0af3f057314f6b06939a108411b8a88d64b for some
missing tests. This code is tightly coupled between
how the SchedulerManager calls FilterScheduler.select_destinations
and how the provider_summaries variable is interpreted differently
when it's None or {}, and is also tightly coupled to how
HostManager._get_computes_for_cells considers compute_uuids being
None or not when grabbing all compute nodes from a cell. Because
of this coupling and complexity, the NOTE in the method is also
updated for clarity.

Change-Id: I3e994d4ad23bf1dd2e46f5d69ff7fdd1a6afdb0e
(cherry picked from commit 129b1205400654a26e70cdb0b4411d204243fc76)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 17:53:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix NoneType error when [service_user] is misconfigured

If the [service_user]/send_service_user_token option is
set to True but the actual auth options are incomplete,
like missing to set the auth_type option, we eventually
fail to re-auth with keystone due to a NoneType error
in keystoneauth1.

We can detect this issue because load_auth_from_conf_options
will return None and we can just log a warning and continue
as if the service user was never configured in the first place.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I0a96c835d620307f1ab34736ba42c2deb1321a23
Closes-Bug: #1733642
(cherry picked from commit cff8b088370c9190e402ece1a9ff48eae27677f7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix NoneType error when [service_user] is misconfigured

If the [service_user]/send_service_user_token option is
set to True but the actual auth options are incomplete,
like missing to set the auth_type option, we eventually
fail to re-auth with keystone due to a NoneType error
in keystoneauth1.

We can detect this issue because load_auth_from_conf_options
will return None and we can just log a warning and continue
as if the service user was never configured in the first place.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I0a96c835d620307f1ab34736ba42c2deb1321a23
Closes-Bug: #1733642
(cherry picked from commit cff8b088370c9190e402ece1a9ff48eae27677f7)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Adds support to retrieve cinder backend pools information

This code additiona allows the collection of cinder backend pool
stats directly from the api. This eliminates the need to poll for
this data directly from ceph or other storage services.

Change-Id: Iabf7a6a5143fc61ec044d6b672a18cfc951219d7

commit_message:
Remove mox3 from requirements

Mox3 was listed in test-requirements, but it is not actually
used anywhere. Since we are trying to remove this package from
OpenStack, removing from requirements so it does not look like
it is being used.

Change-Id: Ifef046cefbf3ed5bf9e644f2836c4e9078f7ccd3

commit_message:
Remove mox3 from requirements

Mox3 was listed in test-requirements, but it is not actually
being used. Since we are trying to remove this package from
OpenStack, removing from requirements so it does not look like
it is being used.

Change-Id: Ibe4ea2d26aa5a7da0b65dcba14e7e7f3e814cca6

[{'created': '2017-12-21 20:50:15.000000000', 'message': 'Use volume shared_targets to lock during attach/detach

The Cinder 3.48 API provides a shared_targets and service_uuid
field in the volume resource which tells the caller whether or
not it should lock operations on that volume.

This change adds that logic to the DriverVolumeBlockDevice attach
and detach flows by first trying to get the volume at the 3.48
microversion and if that's not available, it simply falls back
to get the volume the same as before.

If 3.48 is available and the volume storage backend uses shared
targets, we synchronize the attach/detach operations using the
volume service_uuid, which is based on the storage backend and
is also configurable by the deployer on the Cinder side.

This is a nice to have protection for "normal" volumes but
is really needed for multiattach volumes to be detached safely.

See Cinder blueprint add-shared-targets-flag-to-volume for details.

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: I5e96602184242fb9017c0434b445a3875f3b149a

commit_message:
Use volume shared_targets to lock during attach/detach

The Cinder 3.48 API provides a shared_targets and service_uuid
field in the volume resource which tells the caller whether or
not it should lock operations on that volume.

This change adds that logic to the DriverVolumeBlockDevice attach
and detach flows by first trying to get the volume at the 3.48
microversion and if that's not available, it simply falls back
to get the volume the same as before.

If 3.48 is available and the volume storage backend uses shared
targets, we synchronize the attach/detach operations using the
volume service_uuid, which is based on the storage backend and
is also configurable by the deployer on the Cinder side.

This is a nice to have protection for "normal" volumes but
is really needed for multiattach volumes to be detached safely.

See Cinder blueprint add-shared-targets-flag-to-volume for details.

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Depends-On: I3c07cd8458d55535a71626ffaa8ca50deb3ca3dd

Change-Id: I5e96602184242fb9017c0434b445a3875f3b149a

The bootstrap_nodeid can have capital letters while the hostname may
not. In puppet we use downcase for this comparison, so let's follow a

Change-Id: I8a0bec4a6f3ed0b4f2289cbe7023344fb284edf7

commit_message:
Ignore case for bootstrap node checks

The bootstrap_nodeid can have capital letters while the hostname may
not. In puppet we use downcase for this comparison, so let's follow a
similar pattern for scripts from THT.

Change-Id: I8a0bec4a6f3ed0b4f2289cbe7023344fb284edf7
Closes-Bug: #16998201

'}, {'created': '2018-01-04 15:41:21.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: use 'host-passthrough' as default on AArch64

Nova is assuming 'host-model' for KVM/QEMU setup.

On AArch64 it results in "libvirtError: unsupported configuration: CPU
mode 'host-model' for aarch64 kvm domain on aarch64 host is not
supported by hypervisor" message.

AArch64 lacks 'host-model' support because neither libvirt nor QEMU
are able to tell what the host CPU model exactly is. And there is no
CPU description code for ARM(64) at this point.

So instead we fallback to 'host-passthrough' to get VM instances
running. This will completely break live migration, *unless* all the
Compute nodes (running libvirtd) have *identical* CPUs.

Closes-bug: #1741230

Change-Id: Iafb5f1790d68489db73b9f0549333108c6426a00

commit_message:
libvirt: use 'host-passthrough' as default on AArch64

Nova is assuming 'host-model' for KVM/QEMU setup.

On AArch64 it results in "libvirtError: unsupported configuration: CPU
mode 'host-model' for aarch64 kvm domain on aarch64 host is not
supported by hypervisor" message.

AArch64 lacks 'host-model' support because neither libvirt nor QEMU
are able to tell what the host CPU model exactly is. And there is no
CPU description code for ARM(64) at this point.

So instead we fallback to 'host-passthrough' to get VM instances
running. This will completely break live migration, *unless* all the
Compute nodes (running libvirtd) have *identical* CPUs.

Small summary: https://marcin.juszkiewicz.com.pl/2018/01/04/today-i-was-fighting-with-nova-no-idea-who-won/

Closes-bug: #1741230

Co-authored-by: Kevin Zhao <Kevin.Zhao@arm.com>
Co-authored-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>

Change-Id: Iafb5f1790d68489db73b9f0549333108c6426a00

[{'created': '2018-01-04 18:18:11.000000000', 'message': "Gzip openstack service logs

These files are quite large and disk space is limited so make sure we
compress the log files before copying them to storage. Additionally
os-loganalyze will only operate on gzipped log files so this should fix
os-loganalyze with tempest-full job's logs.

This is mostly a check to confirm everything works as expected but we
probably want to move the gzip step into the log publication roles so
that all log files end up compressed.

Change-Id: Ie87962428e0ca755c211cc5e664a14a9f2a79ac4
"}]
commit_message:
Gzip openstack service logs

These files are quite large and disk space is limited so make sure we
compress the log files before copying them to storage. Additionally
os-loganalyze will only operate on gzipped log files so this should fix
os-loganalyze with tempest-full job's logs.

This is mostly a check to confirm everything works as expected but we
probably want to move the gzip step into the log publication roles so
that all log files end up compressed.

Change-Id: Ie87962428e0ca755c211cc5e664a14a9f2a79ac4

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-01-03 20:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-03 20:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Yeah, if the LB is in error I would assume someone would try a LB failover. Just failing over an amphora might not fix it...'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-03 21:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-03 21:16:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

1) Failing over a specific amphora is more aimed at redistributing amphora to different AZs, hypervisors, etc. -- since an LB can consist of more than one amphora repairing LBs is futile with this command -- so I would take the position if an LB is broken not evacuating amphora won't make it worse

2) For going from ERROR to a different state I would look at the LB failover command. It is an admin level command so it can be assumed that the person executing it is aware of the risks and potential state losses."}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-01-04 18:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Yes, I agree with most of that... So are we good for this then?'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-04 19:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-09 19:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-09 19:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Other than the nit, LGTM'}]

commit_message:
Update image-guide to cirros version 0.4.0

There is a new cirros version. This patch updates the image guide accordingly.
Also the password changed from 'cubswin:)' to 'gocubsgo' in the new image
version.

Change-Id: I59a74adb0f32adf7dcba063e041941bf8b681533

[{'created': '2017-10-24 16:56:11.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: libvirt: Provide VGPU inventory for a single GPU type

libvirt 3.2.0 supports providing number of available vGPUs by passing
in a specific PCI device XML the list of possible mediated device types
a specific physical GPU can support.

See https://libvirt.org/drvnodedev.html#MDEVCap for reference

Using that information to populate a new Resource Class with the
corresponding number of available instances for a configured type.

NOTE : Since a pGPU can support multiple types, we will only ask for Queens
to pass a single type in the configuration option and accumulate the total
number of possible vGPUs for that type by looping over all the physical
devices.

TODO(sbauza) : Needs UTs of course (but I wanted to show first the direction)

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-support-for-vgpu

commit_message:
libvirt: Provide VGPU inventory for a single GPU type

libvirt 3.4.0 supports providing number of available vGPUs by passing
in a specific PCI device XML the list of possible mediated device types
a specific physical GPU can support.

See https://libvirt.org/drvnodedev.html#MDEVCap for reference

Using that information to populate a new Resource Class with the
corresponding number of available instances for a configured type.

NOTE : Since a pGPU can support multiple types, we will only ask for Queens
to pass a single type in the configuration option and accumulate the total
number of possible vGPUs for that type by looping over all the physical
devices.

Change-Id: I6ac601e633ab2b0a67b4802ff880865255188a93
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-support-for-vgpu

commit_message:
Set right status when grow/shrink failed.

We have defined GROWING_ERROR and SHRINKING_ERROR under
instance/task.py. So, when cluster grow/shrink failed, should
set GROWING_ERROR/SHRINGING_ERROR for instances under a cluster.
Currently the code set the default status BUILDING_ERROR_SERVER
when grow/shrink failed.

Change-Id: I3a8a4207df86d30d8af70795f9f045a8e7ddf971

commit_message:
release neutron-lib 1.12.0

This patch releases the latest changes for neutron-lib; summarized in
the highlights section of the yaml herein. We'd like to get these
changes out so we can consume them in neutron and other networking
projects in the near future.

Change-Id: I39d0d96c825915b06b226a388f58f64bc519ee98
